0.title: 3-year-old twins joined at the brain separated using virtual reality in Brazil
0.article_body: A pair of twins who were conjoined at the head have been successfully separated with the help of virtual reality in Brazil. The three-year-old boys underwent seven surgeries, involving over 27 hours of operating time in the final operation alone, and almost 100 medical staff. They are now able to look at each other for the first time.

1.title: Manpreet Kaur qualifies for women's shot put final at CWG 2022
1.article_body: Manpreet Kaur has qualified for the women's shot put final at the Commonwealth Games 2022. Kaur qualified with a throw of 16.78m and was ranked seventh overall in the qualifying rounds. Jamaica's Danniel Thomas-Dodd topped the qualifying rounds with a throw of 18.42m. The automatic qualifying mark was 18m in the event.

2.title: BJP's eyes blindfolded with ego; can't see rising inflation: Rahul
2.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for rising inflation by sharing a chart of increases in prices of eight basic commodities. "BJP went on to claim in the Parliament that there is no inflation in India. Anyways, how will they see rising inflation? Their eyes are blindfolded with ego," Rahul tweeted.

3.title: PMC approves ₹6.24 crore for machine cleaning of public toilets
3.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved ₹6.24 crore for the cleaning of public and community toilets via jetting machines. "PMC used to clean public toilets manually. Following complaints over cleanliness, the civic body has decided to use jetting machines...Zonal officers will float tender, hire agency and handle the project," PMC's Solid Waste Management Department head Asha Raut said.

4.title: Actor Prabhas has weird purity in his eyes: Actress Kriti Sanon
4.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon has said she would "love" to work with her 'Adipurush' co-star Prabhas again. "He has some weird purity in his eyes...he is one of those people whose eyes are really expressive and very deep and there is something very pure," she added. Filmmaker Om Raut is the director of 'Adipurush'.

5.title: Anupam Kher joins cast of Ravi Teja-starrer 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'
5.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher announced on Monday that he has joined the cast of actor Ravi Teja's upcoming film 'Tiger Nageswara Rao'. "My 528th film is Telugu one with great talent in every department," Kher wrote on Instagram while sharing his look from the film. The film is based on a notorious thief and is set in Andhra Pradesh's Stuartpuram village.

6.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening, will go on floors next year: Alia Bhatt
6.article_body: Alia Bhatt has said that 'Jee Le Zaraa' is happening and will go on the floors next year. The film will also feature Priyanka Chopra and Katrina Kaif. "Of course, we cannot go on the floor this year. We ain't letting that film go. We are fighting for it and we are all too excited about it," the actress added.

7.title: US to send $550 million worth of new weapons to Ukraine
7.article_body: The US has announced an additional $550 million in military aid to Ukraine.  The new package will include more ammunition for the High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) and 75,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition, US Defence Department said. "We remain committed to providing Ukraine with the capabilities they need to defend their homeland," US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said.

8.title: Woman throws slipper at Partha Chatterjee while being taken to ED office
8.article_body: A woman threw a slipper at former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee today while he was being taken to the ED office from central government-run hospital near Kolkata. "I had come to throw my slipper on him. He has taken money from poor people. I would have been happier if the slipper would have hit him on his head," she said.

9.title: UK PM candidate Truss to scrap plans to restrict junk food deals
9.article_body: Liz Truss, the leading contender to become UK's next PM, said she will scrap plans to restrict multi-buy deals on unhealthy foods. In an interview, Truss said Britons don't want the government telling them what to eat. In May, UK delayed plans to ban 'buy one get one free' offers on junk food due to cost-of-living crisis.

10.title: Mahua Moitra releases pics with '₹1.5 lakh bag' amid criticism she hid it in Parliament
10.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra has shared photos showing her with her bag on different occasions in the Parliament complex. This comes after she was criticised for allegedly trying to hide the bag, which reports claimed was priced over ₹1.5 lakh, during a debate on inflation. She tweeted, "Jholewala fakir in Parliament since 2019. Jhola leke aye the...jhola leke chal padenge..."

11.title: Karan Johar knows cinema, understands dynamics of filmmaking minutely: Azmi
11.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi, speaking about her experience while filming for 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani', has said that she was amazed at filmmaker Karan Johar's understanding of the craft. Karan is the director of the film. "Karan is a director who knows cinema and understands the dynamics and nuances of filmmaking minutely," she further added.

12.title: Bajaj Auto two-wheeler sales drop by 5% in July to 3.15 lakh units
12.article_body: Bajaj Auto on Monday reported a 5% fall in its total two-wheeler sales at 3,15,054 units in July 2022 as against 3,30,569 units in the corresponding period last year. While domestic two-wheeler sales rose by 5% to 1,64,384 units, exports fell by 14%. The commercial vehicle sales rose by 3% with 39,616 units sold against 38,547 units in July 2021.

13.title: Pelosi's Taiwan visit will undermine US-China relations: China
13.article_body: Chinese Ambassador to UN, Zhang Jun, has said that US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit would undermine the relationship between China and the US. "Such a visit is apparently very much dangerous and provocative," Zhang said during a news conference. Zhang also urged Washington to honour the one-China principle. US said it will not be intimidated by China's warnings.

14.title: SpiceJet clears all pending dues with Airports Authority of India
14.article_body: SpiceJet entered into an agreement with the Airports Authority of India (AAI) and cleared all outstanding principal dues of the airport operator. In 2020, the AAI had put SpiceJet on a ‘cash and carry’ basis for the failure to clear its previous dues. Under this model, an airline has to make payments to the AAI for various charges every day.

15.title: Had to play dad to 20-year-old, I thought 'F*** you': Colin on 1st older role
15.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell said that he almost took offence when he was offered his first older role. "I do remember first time I got script where I was playing father of someone who was 20 and I thought, 'F*** you'. I realised it was an absolutely inappropriate offer to make," he said, adding that he's having fun in his 40s.

16.title: Nigerian national in Delhi tests positive for monkeypox, 3rd case in national capital
16.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported its third confirmed case of monkeypox. This comes after a 31-year-old man from Nigeria, admitted to the Lok Nayak Hospital, tested positive for the virus. "India currently has eight confirmed cases of monkeypox. Out of the eight patients, five have a history of foreign travel," Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said.

17.title: 6 Army jawans booked in Raj after man admitted by them to hospital dies
17.article_body: An FIR has been registered against six Army jawans in Rajasthan after a 24-year-old man whom they had admitted to a hospital in Pokhran died, police said. The man and his friend had gone to the prohibited firing range in Pokhran on a motorcycle. The man's family claimed that he was caught by the jawans who thrashed him badly.

18.title: Wanted younger actress for Kareena's role, would've been mistake: Aamir on 'Laal...'
18.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the team was originally looking for a younger actress for Kareena Kapoor's role in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "That was a mistake we were making," he added. Aamir said they were looking at a video of another actor and accidentally saw Kareena in it. "Since she wasn't 25, we didn't think of her," he said.

19.title: Any experimentation should be avoided: Rajkumar on Suryakumar opening
19.article_body: Reacting to batter Suryakumar Yadav opening the innings in the T20I series against West Indies, Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "This is a huge experiment." "Any experimentation involving him should be avoided," added Rajkumar. Discussing the decision to send Suryakumar as an opener, ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth stated, "Please don't do that...Don't spoil the cricketer."

20.title: NMMT introduces buses for Bhiwandi from Navi Mumbai's Airoli
20.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has introduced a new bus route to Thane's Bhiwandi from Airoli in Navi Mumbai. The bus service started on Monday (August 1) and frequency of the service is 25 to 30 minutes, as per reports. The places that come in the new route are Airoli, Thane, Majiwada, Bhiwandi Bypass and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Chowk.

21.title: Oppo, Vivo India & Xiaomi served notices for alleged tax evasion: Sitharaman
21.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed Rajya Sabha that three Chinese mobile companies- Oppo, Vivo India and Xiaomi have been served notices for alleged tax evasion by them. She said, while Oppo has been sent a notice for total customs duty of ₹4,389 crore, three show-cause notices have been issued to Xiaomi for an approximate duty liability of about ₹653 crore.

22.title: I sacrificed stardom to get freedom to cater to audience I wanted: Abhay
22.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol has stated that he had to sacrifice his stardom to be allowed the freedom to cater to the audience he wanted. He said that he was told to take advantage of the image of the Deol family. "Even though I did the films I did, it's difficult to...be constantly pushing because...filmmaking is a collective process," Abhay added.

23.title: Disappointing to lose film to A-lister who didn't even audition: Harleen
23.article_body: Actress Harleen Sethi stated that it's disappointing to lose a Bollywood film to an A-lister after being locked for six months. "I...get messages from directors saying, 'It was the best audition and you were the closest'," she said. The actress added that it happened recently when an A-lister got her part without even giving an audition or a look test.

24.title: Telecom sector may see ₹2-3 trillion investment in next 2 yrs: Vaishnaw
24.article_body: Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said India's telecom industry is likely to see investment of ₹2-3 trillion in next two years as reforms by the government have removed uncertainty and risks. "It's going to be significant investment by the industry," he said. Vaishnaw added that he's sure that the trend of affordable services will continue as operators start launching 5G services.

25.title: 99% of Florida's turtles born female due to hotter summers: Study
25.article_body: According to study, 99% of turtles born in Florida in the past four years have turned out to be female, thanks to hotter summers. According to researchers, the sex of sea turtles depends on temperature of developing eggs. If a turtle's egg is incubated below 27.7°C, the hatchling will be male, but if it's incubated above 31°C, it'll be female.

26.title: 2 held for theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 cr in Mumbai, 1 absconding
26.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested two diamond brokers, Bharat Kandol and Amrut Bhai Patel, in connection with the theft of diamonds worth ₹3.5 crore, an official said on Monday. The mastermind behind the crime, Kaushik Chovatila, is absconding, the official added. The accused allegedly contacted a diamond merchant, expressing interest in purchasing diamonds, after which they stole the stones.

27.title: 76-yr-old rapes minor by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, held
27.article_body: Two men, including a 76-year-old, were arrested for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl multiple times by luring her with ₹10 in Chhattisgarh, police said on Tuesday. The incident came to light when a woman from the victim's neighbourhood saw her coming out of the houses of the two accused and informed her parents, Balodabazar kotwali SHO Yadumani Sidar said.

28.title: Muhammed Yahiya, Sreeshankar qualify for men's long jump final at CWG 2022
28.article_body: India's Muhammed Anees Yahiya and Sreeshankar Murali have qualified for the men's long jump final at CWG 2022. Sreeshankar topped the qualifying rounds with an 8.05m jump to advance to the final, while Anees Yahiya produced an effort of 7.68m to be ranked eighth overall. Notably, Sreeshankar was the only one to cross the 8m automatic qualifying mark.

29.title: Multi-million dollars worth of crypto stolen from crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge'
29.article_body: US crypto firm Nomad's 'bridge', a tool which allows users to transfer tokens between blockchains, has been hit with a multi-million dollar theft. According to blockchain researchers, $150-$190 million worth of users' cryptocurrencies, including ether and USDC, were stolen. Nomad tweeted that it was "aware of the incident" and was currently investigating it but didn't disclose the theft's value.

30.title: Disappointed with govt: Family of BSF constable killed in Congo
30.article_body: The family of the BSF head constable Shishupal Singh Bagadia, who was killed in Congo, has said that they are "disappointed" with the Rajasthan government as nobody shared proper information. "No one reached out... We know how we spent the last six-seven days, how difficult it was," Bagadia's wife Kamla Devi said in presence of PCC chief Govind Dotasra.

31.title: 3 rob food delivery executive of his scooter in Delhi, arrested
31.article_body: Three men were arrested for allegedly robbing a scooter from a food delivery executive in Delhi's Subhash Place area, police said on Tuesday. The complainant said that the accused tried to steal his phone and attacked him with a sharp object when he resisted. The accused escaped with his scooter when he fell down, the complainant added.

32.title: Drugs worth ₹15 cr seized in Assam's Karbi Anglong, 3 arrested
32.article_body: Police said three persons were arrested on Tuesday and different types of drugs worth ₹15 crore were seized from them in Assam's Karbi Anglong district. According to a senior police official, the accused were heading towards West Bengal's Siliguri from Manipur. The seizures include 380 gm of heroin, one kg of morphine and two kg of methamphetamine, the official added.

33.title: Slain al-Qaeda chief Zawahiri penned a poem for Karnataka girl over hijab issue
33.article_body: Al-Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri, who was killed in a US drone strike in Kabul on Sunday, had recently released a video in which he spoke on the issue of hijab in Karnataka's educational institutions. He also penned a poem praising Muskan Khan, the girl who gained popularity for confronting a group of boys who were opposed to girls wearing hijab.

34.title: India to extend extra $100 mn line of credit to Maldives: PM Modi
34.article_body: After a meeting with Maldives' President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih in New Delhi on Tuesday, PM Narendra Modi said that India will extend an additional $100 million line of credit to the island nation. "In the last few years, there has been a renewed vigor in the friendly relations between India and Maldives, our closeness has increased," PM Modi tweeted.

35.title: US deploys 4 warships near Taiwan amid Chinese warnings over House Speaker's visit
35.article_body: Four US Navy warships have been positioned in waters east of Taiwan amid repeated Chinese warnings over House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's imminent visit to the island nation. An aircraft carrier is among the four vessels that have been deployed in the Philippines Sea, a US Navy official confirmed to Reuters. The official, however, said these were "routine deployments".

36.title: Nation is proud of your achievement: Harbhajan on Shushila's CWG 2022 silver
36.article_body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to congratulate judoka Shushila Devi for winning silver medal at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday and wrote, "Nation is proud of your achievement in Birmingham. Keep it up." Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Exceptional performance Shushila Devi...congratulations India on the silver medal!" Shushila won silver in the women's 48 kg final.

37.title: Europe’s ‘last known’ giant panda species discovered in Bulgaria
37.article_body: A new species of giant panda believed to be the "last known" and "most evolved" of its kind in Europe has been discovered in the wetlands of Bulgaria. "Although not a direct ancestor of the modern...giant panda, it is its close relative," a researcher said. The species that lived six million years ago likely fed on softer plant materials.

38.title: Average time taken to probe a rape case reduced to 57 days in Rajasthan: Police
38.article_body: The average time taken to probe a rape case in Rajasthan has reduced to 57 days as of June 2022, a police spokesperson said. The average time taken to probe a rape case was 435 days in 2017. It reduced to 211 days in 2018, 140 days in 2019, 117 days in 2020 and 86 days in 2021, spokesperson added.

39.title: 20 historical sites identified for 'national importance tag': Centre
39.article_body: At least 20 heritage and religious sites have been identified for the 'national importance tag', Centre said. They include the two ancient mounds at Haryana's Rakhigarhi, rock painting at Chintakunta in Andhra Pradesh and Kaleshwar Mahadev Temple in Himachal Pradesh. Notably, the Rakhigarhi site is one of the "five iconic sites", which was declared by Centre in Union Budget 2020-21.

40.title: Armed man arrested near TRS MLA Jeevan Reddy's house in Hyderabad
40.article_body: A person moving with a firearm near the house of Hyderabad MLA Jeevan Reddy has been arrested. The man has been identified as Prasad Goud, the husband of a village sarpanch who was recently suspended from the TRS. He was moving under suspicious circumstances in Vemuri Enclave and a gun and a knife were recovered from him.

41.title: Man chops off policeman's lips, ears, nose for having affair with his wife in Pakistan
41.article_body: A policeman's nose, ears and lips were chopped off by a man who accused him of blackmailing his wife and forcing her to have illicit relations with him, police in Pakistan's Punjab province said. "Iftikhar, who suspected Hayat (policeman) of having relations with his wife, in connivance with 12 accomplices abducted him on his way back home," police stated.

42.title: Shot with Aamir when I was over 5 months pregnant: Kareena on ageism
42.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan, speaking about ageism in Bollywood, said, "Age is just a number...people are doing different characters...you're as old as you look." Kareena added she was five and a half months pregnant when she shot with Aamir Khan for 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "So, it's up to the person to break boundaries and take up the challenge," she stated.

43.title: Kareena possibly wasn't keen on working with new director: Onir on Chameli
43.article_body: Filmmaker Onir said that film producer Rangita Nandy offered him to direct 'Chameli' after filmmaker Anant Balani died of a heart attack. "I half-heartedly agreed and was kind of relieved when things didn't work out, possibly because Kareena (Kapoor) was not keen on working with a new director," Onir wrote in his book.

44.title: Entire TMC a thief: WB BJP president on Partha, Arpita arrests
44.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said that the entire Trinamool Congress (TMC) is a "thief". "TMC has been lying from the very beginning, Arpita Mukherjee is a political personality...she used to be part of Partha Chatterjee's political campaigns and other programmes of TMC," Majumdar alleged. This comes after a huge amount of cash was seized from Mukherjee's flats.

45.title: Australian Senator calls Queen Elizabeth a 'coloniser' while taking oath
45.article_body: Australian Senator, Lidia Thorpe, referred to Queen Elizabeth II as a "coloniser" while being sworn into Australia's Parliament. The Indigenous senator was forced to redo the oath of allegiance after the Senate President interjected. The 96-year-old British monarch is also Australia's head of state. After reciting the pledge as required, Thorpe took to Twitter and said, "Sovereignty never ceded."

46.title: Mark Rutte becomes Netherlands' longest-serving Prime Minister
46.article_body: Mark Rutte on Tuesday became the Netherlands' longest-serving Prime Minister. Rutte has been in charge for 4,311 days, since he first became PM in October 2010, a day longer than Ruud Lubbers who led the Netherlands in the 1980s and early '90s. The 55-year-old is the second longest-serving elected leader in the 27-nation European Union, trailing only Hungary's Viktor Orban.

47.title: Former beauty queen Sarah Davies lifts 229 kg to win weightlifting gold at CWG 2022
47.article_body: Former beauty queen-turned-weightlifter Sarah Davies, who had won Miss Leeds and Miss Intercontinental England titles, bagged a gold medal in women's weightlifting at CWG 2022. She lifted a total of 229 kg, with 103 kg in snatch and 126 kg in clean and jerk to win the women's 71-kg category. Sarah had won silver at CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

48.title: Jan 6 rioter who took gun to US Capitol & threatened Nancy Pelosi jailed for 7 years
48.article_body: A federal judge on Monday sentenced Guy Reffitt, who brought a gun to the US Capitol during the January 6, 2021 riot and threatened House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, to over seven years in prison, the longest Capitol riot-related sentence to date. "Mr Reffitt's reluctance to admit early that his behavior is illegal is concerning," District Judge Dabney Friedrich said.

49.title: Naga minister takes part in traditional dance, says 'I can dance too'
49.article_body: Nagaland minister Temjen Imna Along took to Twitter to share a video of himself participating in a traditional dance. "See, I can dance too!" Along tweeted. The BJP MLA said the video was from Tsungremong, a festival of the Ao Nagas celebrated for invoking blessing of a bountiful harvest. Along also invited people to visit Nagaland to explore its culture.

50.title: 21-year-old man charged under NSA for setting fire to UP hospital
50.article_body: A 21-year-old man has been charged under National Security Act (NSA) for allegedly setting fire to a portion of a hospital building in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district on June 28. The accused, identified as Raja Ansari, was arrested in July, police said. Earlier, it was reported that Ansari committed the crime after being denied free medicine by the hospital's staff.

51.title: If his favourite book falls, I know he's around somewhere: Sutapa on Irrfan
51.article_body: Writer Sutapa Sikdar, wife of late actor Irrfan Khan, in an interview said, "Even though he's gone, I know he's around." "Especially at nights, if it's raining, or his favourite book falls, I know he's around somewhere," she added. Sutapa further said they often slept in different rooms as Irrfan was a night person and she was a day person.

52.title: Exclusionary to vegetarians: BJP leader as K’taka plans eggs for midday meals
52.article_body: BJP leader Tejaswini Ananth Kumar on Tuesday asked why has the Karnataka government decided to give eggs to students in midday meals. "These are not the only source of nutrition. It’s also exclusionary to many students who are vegetarians," she tweeted. "Our policies are to be designed such that every student has equal opportunity," she added.

53.title: Suspecting infidelity, man slits wife's throat in front of landlord in Punjab
53.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his 35-year-old wife by slitting her throat in front of their landlord in Punjab's Ludhiana. The accused's wife used to work as a beautician and visited clients' homes. The accused used to stop her from going out and suspected her of infidelity, police said.

54.title: Modified 'Laal...' based on reaction by Rajamouli, Nagarjuna: Aamir
54.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said he made a change in his film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' based on the reactions of 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli, 'Pushpa: The Rise' director Sukumar and actors Nagarjuna and Chiranjeevi. "The change was very correct," he added. Aamir organised a special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' for them, following which Chiranjeevi hugged Aamir who was in tears.

55.title: There is no good, bad Taliban; will never support terrorism: Digvijaya
55.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM and Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has said that he commends the elimination of Al Qaeda's chief Ayman al- Zawahiri. "There is no Good Taliban and Bad Taliban," Singh said. He added, "My BJP-Sanghi friends have an illness of speaking lies. I will never support terrorism...irrespective of which country or religion they belong to."

56.title: Corruption charges against Opposition leaders based on evidence: BJP
56.article_body: BJP on Tuesday refuted indulging in vendetta politics, saying charges of corruption against Opposition leaders are based on evidence and facts, not rhetoric. "The Opposition shouldn't politicise corruption," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He added BJP will never interfere in the work of investigation agencies. This comes after Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED in Patra Chawl scam.

57.title: Man dies after falling into cauldron of porridge at temple in TN's Madurai
57.article_body: A man reportedly died of burn injuries after he fell into a cauldron of porridge at Muthu Mariyammam temple in Tamil Nadu's Madurai. The man, Muthukumar, fainted and lost his balance before falling into the cauldron, a CCTV footage of the incident showed. People pulled Muthukumar out of the cauldron and rushed him to a nearby hospital.

58.title: 6 more held in K'taka in Fazil murder case; police say 'attack pre-planned'
58.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Mangaluru have arrested six more persons in connection with the murder of 23-year-old Fazil in the Surathkal area on July 28. According to police, the attack was pre-planned and the accused had been observing Fazil for a few days before attacking him. So far, around 51 people have been questioned in this connection, police added.

59.title: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase likely to be inaugurated on Aug 15
59.article_body: Mumbai-Nagpur expressway's first phase, a 480 km stretch between Shirdi and Nagpur, has been completed and is intended to be inaugurated on August 15, said Radheshyam Mopalwar, MD of Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation. "We're planning to complete the entire 700-km stretch by end of May 2023," he said. "Toll collection systems, petrol pumps, everything is ready," he added.

60.title: Vehicle carrying Central Vista workers hits bus in Delhi; 28 hospitalised
60.article_body: As many as 28 people were taken to a hospital after a private vehicle, in which labourers from the Central Vista project were travelling, hit a cluster bus from behind in Delhi's Ranjeet Nagar on Tuesday, police said. The private vehicle's driver suffered severe injuries, police added. Of those injured, three people were from the cluster bus, police further added.

61.title: BMTC introduces new bus route between Silk Institute metro and airport
61.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) has added a new Vayuvajra bus route called 'KIA-5D' connecting commuters from the Silk Institute metro station to Kempegowda International Airport (KIA). This route takes commuters from Silk Institute to Bengaluru airport through the Konanakunte Cross, Banashankari, Jayanagara 4th Block, Shanthinagara TTMC, RM Guttahalli and Hebbala.

62.title: You take 100-200 days to finish film, Akshay does in 30 days: Kareena to Aamir
62.article_body: In the promo of the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan 7', actress Kareena Kapoor Khan can be seen telling actor Aamir Khan that he takes 100-200 days to finish a film while actor Akshay Kumar finishes one in 30 days. Her comment came in response to being asked what she tolerates in Aamir but wouldn't tolerate in others.

63.title: We were back in the game thanks to our bowlers: India bowling coach Mhambrey
63.article_body: India bowling coach Paras Mhambrey has said they have a lot of positives to take from their defeat in the second T20I against the West Indies. "We didn't have many runs...[but] we pretty much came [back] in the game thanks to our bowers," added Mhambrey. "I'm happy with the potential [young bowlers] have shown in [recent] games," he further said.

64.title: Kanpur school manager booked after students forced to recite 'Kalma'
64.article_body: The manager of Florets International School in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur has been booked after students were allegedly forced to recite 'Kalma' during morning prayers. This comes after a student's father alleged that "seeds of conversion" were being sown in children at the school. "Now, only the National Anthem is being sung during morning prayers," Kanpur ACP Nishank Sharma said.

65.title: Mob storms into check post, attacks police & frees drug smuggler in Punjab
65.article_body: A group of people, including women, reportedly stormed into the Chawinda Devi police check post that falls under the jurisdiction of Amritsar Rural Police on Monday. They attacked four on-duty policemen and freed an alleged drug smuggler from their custody. The crowd claimed the man, who was caught with nine grams of heroin, wasn't a smuggler but a drug addict.

66.title: Johar, Pandya, KL Rahul found innocent by court over comments on women on 'Koffee...'
66.article_body: The Jodhpur High Court granted relief to cricketers Hardik Pandya and KL Rahul and director Karan Johar, in a case registered against the trio. It was registered for alleged offensive remarks on women made by the cricketers on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2018. According to reports, the court disposed of the case after they were found 'innocent'.

67.title: Outstanding accomplishment: PM as UPI transactions hit record 6 billion in July
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has lauded the "outstanding accomplishment" of record number of UPI transactions in July. About 6.28 billion UPI transactions worth over ₹10.62 lakh crore took place last month, the highest ever since UPI's inception in 2016. "It indicates the collective resolve of the people of India to embrace new technologies and make the economy cleaner," the PM said.

68.title: Unacademy suspends contracts of some educators, to cut doubt-solving: Report
68.article_body: Edtech unicorn Unacademy has suspended contracts of some of its doubt-solving NEET and IIT-JEE educators for a minimum of six months, Moneycontrol reported. In an email to educators, Unacademy said it will "significantly" reduce doubt solving on its platform. Last month, CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a slew of measures to cut costs, including pay cuts for founders and top management.

69.title: BharatPe Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya resigns months after Ashneer Grover's exit
69.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Bhavik Koladiya, who ran the product and technology operations for the company, has quit. While BharatPe said Koladiya wants to "spend time on other assignments outside" the firm, a report, while quoting sources, said that he resigned due to disagreements with CEO Suhail Sameer. His resignation comes months after the exit of BharatPe's other Co-founder Ashneer Grover.

70.title: I won't do any more projects if I do Bhansali's 'Heeramandi': Mumtaz
70.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz has said she would not do any more projects if she does filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi'. "Sanjay is the best filmmaker in India. I would love to work with him if I like my role [in 'Heeramandi']," she added. She further said that she does not have the "liberty" to discuss anything about the film.

71.title: Man stabs cousin 38 times over old dispute in Pune's Baramati; held
71.article_body: A 27-year-old barber was allegedly stabbed to death 38 times by his maternal cousin in a village near Baramati on Monday, Pune Rural Police said. The victim, Gajanan Pawar, was allegedly attacked by the accused, Santosh Gulmule, after an altercation broke out between them over an old dispute. Gulmule was arrested from a railway station while trying to escape.

72.title: Delhi HC quashes rape FIR, tells complainant to offer social service
72.article_body: The Delhi High Court has quashed a rape FIR by a woman complainant with a direction to her to offer social service at All India Confederation of the Blind for two months. The case was settled before the court hearing under which it stated that the parties had a money dispute. The accused has been directed to plant 50 trees.

73.title: Dhoni visits us, he said he plays lawn bowls in Australia: Lovely who reached CWG final
73.article_body: Lovely Choubey, who's a part of India's women's fours lawn bowls team that reached final at CWG 2022, said MS Dhoni knows a lot about their sport. She added he knows their coach and visits them in Ranchi. "We had a chat about the sport as well. He said...whenever he's in Australia he goes to play lawn bowls," Lovely said.

74.title: Taiwan starts 'preparing for war' with China
74.article_body: The Taiwanese Ministry of National Defense has begun to "immediately prepare for war" and has put the military on high alert, local news outlets reported. This comes amid repeated Chinese warnings of military action over the reported upcoming visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi. Taiwan is reportedly preparing air-raid shelters for citizens and has cancelled soldiers' and officers' leaves.

75.title: Delhi HC quashes Arms Act FIR against man, tells him to give sanitisers to students
75.article_body: Delhi High Court quashed an FIR against a US resident who was found with a live bullet at the Indira Gandhi International Airport. The man had claimed that his uncle used a licensed weapon during celebratory firing at Diwali and a cartridge remained in his pocket. The court directed him to distribute mosquito repellents and hand sanitisers to school students.

76.title: 4 doctors, a manager booked for negligence after fire kills 8 at MP hospital
76.article_body: Four doctors and a manager were booked for negligence after a fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur and killed eight people. The doctors are absconding, while the manager has been arrested, police said. "If government officials are found involved for giving permissions overlooking lapses, a case will be registered against them," SP Siddharth Bahuguna said.

77.title: Musk sued by Twitter investor with 5,500 shares over $44 bn buyout deal
77.article_body: A Twitter investor holding 5,500 shares has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk with proposed class action and has named two "corporate acquisition entities" related to the deal as defendants apart from Musk. The shareholder seeks a court order compelling Musk to go through with his $44 billion deal. The new suit targets Musk's "lame rationales for reneging on his contract".

78.title: Twitter banned 43,140 Indian users in June for violating guidelines
78.article_body: Twitter banned 43,140 accounts of Indian users in June 2022 over violation of its guidelines, according to Twitter's July 2022 compliance report. Twitter removed 40,982 accounts for child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity and similar content, while 2,158 accounts were banned for promoting terrorism. Twitter's local grievance mechanism received 724 grievances between May 26 and June 25.

79.title: ED investigates GST number linked to Arpita Mukherjee
79.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a GST number linked to former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee’s close aide Arpita Mukherjee in connection to the SSC scam. "She used one GST number for running a beauty parlour business. We are trying to find out whether this one was generated in an illegal manner to evade taxes," an ED official said.

80.title: Cabinet rejig is to divert attention: BJP Bengal Chief
80.article_body: BJP Bengal chief Sukanta Majumdar on Monday took a potshot at CM Mamata Banerjee over Cabinet reshuffle. “Banerjee is taking such decisions to divert the media’s attention from the corruption cases,” said Majumdar while referring to the arrest of former Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee. Earlier, Mamata had announced to reshuffle the Cabinet.

81.title: CM Shinde cancels garden inauguration in Pune after controversy over name
81.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde cancelled a garden inauguration programme in Pune after controversy erupted over reports that the garden was developed on public land and named after him. "We have cancelled the inauguration. We will put up a proposal with the name of the garden to Pune Municipal Corporation's garden committee for further decision," Shinde supporter Nana Bhangire said.

82.title: BJP, Cong workers clash in Tripura's Charilam; Section 144 imposed
82.article_body: CrPC Section 144 was imposed in Tripura's Charilam after a clash broke out between the workers of BJP and Congress. The police said that a group of BJP workers tried to provoke people during a political event organised by the Congress, after which they resorted to lathi charge. Meanwhile, Deputy CM Jishnu Dev Varma blamed the Congress for triggering violence.

83.title: Peacock wrapped in Tiranga after death in UP's Ghaziabad, video surfaces
83.article_body: A peacock was wrapped in Tiranga after it passed away in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. A video that surfaced online showed police personnel carrying the body of the peacock, wrapped in India's national flag, on a stretcher. According to reports, a Twitter user mentioned that the peacock was found dead at the Kaushambi metro station of the region.

84.title: Bengaluru likely to witness heavy rainfall today, tomorrow: IMD
84.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that urban areas in Bengaluru are likely to witness heavy rainfall today and tomorrow. This comes after heavy showers in the city on Monday evening left several areas inundated. While power outages were reported in BTM and HSR Layout, water entered houses in Yelahanka, Yelachenahalli and some regions in north Bengaluru, reports said.

85.title: Biden says he's ready for nuclear deal with Russia as UN talks begin
85.article_body: US President Joe Biden said he is ready for new nuclear arms deal with Russia, calling upon Russian President Vladimir Putin to act in good faith. In a written statement to NPT review conference, Putin said that there will be no winners in a nuclear war. Putin had put nuclear arms on high alert days after Russian invasion of Ukraine.

86.title: Nuclear annihilation just one miscalculation away, warns UN chief
86.article_body: The world is "just one misunderstanding, one miscalculation away from nuclear annihilation", UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said while speaking at the opening of a Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty conference. The conference is taking place "at a time of nuclear danger not seen since the height of the Cold War", he added, citing Russia-Ukraine war and "many other factors around the world".

87.title: Container truck carrying chemical overturns on Ghodbunder Road in Thane
87.article_body: A container truck transporting tanks of hydrogen peroxide chemical overturned on the busy Ghodbunder Road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. The gas from the container leaked on the road, emitting a foul odour. The accident resulted in a huge traffic jam, officials said. "There are no cases of anyone affected due to the chemical leak," an official said.

88.title: Has any BJP leader faced CBI, ED action: NCP youth wing poster in Aurangabad
88.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party's youth wing has put up banners in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, asking if any leader from the Bharatiya Janata Party has ever faced CBI or ED action. The poster that has NYC state secretary Akshay Patil's picture and contact details, also asked if any agency continued its probe against a leader after they switched over to the BJP.

89.title: 1.6 million coca leaf bushes seized in Honduras
89.article_body: Honduran authorities seized more than 1.6 million coca leaf bushes on Monday. Officials said that the bushes, used to make cocaine, were located in mountainous areas in the coastal department of Colon after a three-day operation. According to security forces statistics, total 2,625,015 bushes have been seized this year, significantly up from 531,826 bushes seized in 2021.

90.title: WI's Obed McCoy dedicates 'Man of the Match' award vs India to his mother
90.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, who broke the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India in the second T20I on Monday, dedicated his 'Man of the Match' award to his mother. "She is sick and she has motivated me to be a better player," said McCoy at the post-match presentation. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 in the match.

91.title: Ex-K'taka minister's employee steals valuables from his B'luru home, arrested
91.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested an employee of former Karnataka Home Minister MB Patil for allegedly stealing foreign currency and valuables from his house in Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar. The accused, Jayanth Kumar, is a native of Odisha. Kumar used to work as a laundryman at Patil's home, police said, adding that he gifted the stolen watches to his friends in Odisha.

92.title: Goa CM urges citizens to join ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign
92.article_body: Ahead of the country's 75th Independence Day celebrations, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant urged people to participate in the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and hoist the tricolour flag at their houses from August 13 to 16. “I urge Goans to keep the national flag as their display picture on social media from August 2 onwards,” Sawant said.

93.title: Polio was in NYC wastewater a month before case was detected: Official
93.article_body: New York health officials said that polio virus was present in wastewater of New York City suburb a month before health officials confirmed a case last month. In an emailed statement, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said there may be more people shedding the virus in their stool. Officials urged residents to be sure they are vaccinated.

94.title: Went wicketless after Murali wished me luck: Nilesh on 1997 Test vs SL
94.article_body: Recalling a Test match against Sri Lanka in 1997, ex-India spinner Nilesh Kulkarni said he got a wicket off his first ball in the match, but couldn't take a wicket in the game after that. "I'd met Muttiah Muralitharan...[after the day's play], he said '...Good luck for...next three days'. Little did I realise...I wouldn't pick a wicket," added Nilesh.

95.title: Storms hit Kentucky's flooded areas, curfews imposed due to looting
95.article_body: Disaster-hit areas in eastern Kentucky witnessed another round of storms on Monday. Death toll due to floods rose to 37 on Tuesday. According to Governor, rescue operations continue at a time when hundreds of people remain unaccounted for. Authorities declared county-wide nighttime curfews amidst looting reports in Breathitt County and Hindman in Knott County, which are devastated due to floods.

96.title: Go First car goes under IndiGo plane, narrowly avoiding collision at Delhi airport
96.article_body: A car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at Delhi airport on Tuesday, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel. The aircraft was readying to depart for Dhaka when the incident took place. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. According to officials, the DGCA will investigate the incident.

97.title: Whenever you do 'Koffee...' someone cries: Aamir Khan to Karan Johar
97.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' which is hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar, actor Aamir Khan said, "Whenever you do your show, someone...cries." Aamir was accompanied by actress Kareena Kapoor. Responding to a question about the thing she tolerates about Aamir, Kareena stated him taking 100-200 days for shooting a film, which Akshay Kumar does in 30 days.

98.title: I really have to work on my phrasing: Brad Pitt on retirement claim
98.article_body: On being asked about his statement of being in the "last semester or trimester" of his career, actor Brad Pitt said that he really has to work on his phrasing. "I was just saying I'm past middle age and I want to be specific about how I spend those last things however they may be," the actor added.

99.title: Arshdeep has bowled tough overs for PBKS, that's why he was confident vs WI: Parthiv
99.article_body: Talking about pacer Arshdeep Singh, ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said the 23-year-old was "confident" in his bowling in the second T20I against West Indies on Monday. "Arshdeep has been bowling those tough overs [for PBKS], that's the reason why you could see the confidence in him," added Parthiv. Arshdeep registered figures of 1/26 off his four overs in the game.

100.title: DDA's cash deficit due to unsold housing inventory of ₹18,000 cr: Govt
100.article_body: Delhi Development Authority's cash deficit of ₹9,615 crore is primarily due to unsold housing inventory worth around ₹18,000 crore, Housing and Urban Affairs Minister of State, Kaushal Kishore, informed the Rajya Sabha. The housing stock is lying unsold since 2014 as small flats located in the Narela area are deemed to be too costly and lack Metro connectivity, Kishore stated.

101.title: 10 villa owners booked for illegal rentals in Pune's Lonavala
101.article_body: Pune's Lonavala police have booked 10 villa owners between July 29 and July 31 for allegedly illegally renting their properties to tourists. The city's municipal council also urged owners to not rent villas without checking safety measures. "Our drive has intensified after...two recent deaths. Owners should either get requisite licence or stop renting villas and bungalows," an inspector said.

102.title: Terrorists hurl grenade at police post in J&K's Ramban
102.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a police post in the Gool area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district on Tuesday, said officials. The grenade exploded on the roof of the police post, however, no injuries were reported. Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force (JKGF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, has claimed responsibility for the attack in a letter, said ADGP Mukesh Singh.

103.title: California declares state of emergency over monkeypox outbreak
103.article_body: California has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of monkeypox in a bid to escalate efforts to combat the outbreak. Emergency medical officials will be allowed to administer monkeypox vaccines approved by the federal government. Last week, the state expanded its testing capacity to carry out more than 1,000 tests a week.

104.title: Russian action at Ukraine's nuclear plant risks terrible accident: US
104.article_body: The US has accused Russia of using Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as a 'nuclear shield' and risking a terrible nuclear accident. US said that Russia has stationed troops near Zaporizhzhia plant, Ukraine's biggest nuclear power plant, and preventing Ukrainian forces from returning fire. In March, Russia was accused of firing shells dangerously close to the nuclear power plant.

105.title: US might control export of its chipmaking equipment to China: Report
105.article_body: US might limit shipment of American chipmaking equipment to Chinese memory chip makers with an aim to stop China's semiconductor sector advances, reports said. US might ban the export of tools to China used to make NAND chips. If amended, this would be first US step to target China's production of memory chips without specialised military apps through export controls.

106.title: Arvind Kejriwal promises free education and jobs in Gujarat
106.article_body: AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday criticised BJP over unemployment and hooch tragedies in Gujarat. "I appeal to the people to choose AAP if you want free quality education and employment for your youth. You may vote for the BJP if you wish to feed them spurious liquor," said Kejriwal. He also promised unemployment allowance if AAP wins the polls.

107.title: Reduce fossil fuel use, adopt green energy for public transport: Gadkari
107.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari stressed on the need to reduce fossil fuel consumption and adopt green energy for public transport and said the fare in electric buses can be 30% less than diesel ones. "Need to change country's transport system...Instead of petrol and diesel, we should focus on cheaper options like electricity, green hydrogen, ethanol and Bio-CNG," Gadkari added.

108.title: ED searches newspaper head office in Delhi in National Herald case
108.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches at multiple places, including Herald House on Delhi's Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, reports said. The searches were conducted in connection with ED's probe into the National Herald case under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Searches were conducted days after Congress President Sonia Gandhi was questioned in case.

109.title: Law student stabs classmate over love triangle in Lucknow university
109.article_body: A law student stabbed his classmate multiple times with a machete over an alleged love triangle at a private university in Lucknow. The victim suffered injuries around his neck, head and hands and has undergone multiple surgeries. The victim and accused had a fight a few days ago over a girl in their class. The accused is in custody.

110.title: Delhi's 1st monkeypox patient discharged: LNJP Hospital MD
110.article_body: Delhi's first monkeypox patient has been successfully discharged, Suresh Kumar, the Medical Director (MD) of the national capital's LNJP Hospital, said on Tuesday. He added that the man, who had no history of foreign travel, recovered in 25 days as "all symptoms waned away". This comes a day after a second monkeypox case was reported in Delhi.

111.title: Productivity at Google is not where it needs to be, there are real concerns: CEO
111.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai at a recent all-hands meeting said, "There are real concerns that our productivity...is not where it needs to be for the headcount we have." Pichai asked employees to help "create a culture that is more mission-focused", CNBC reported. "We should think about how we can minimise distractions and really raise the bar on...productivity," he added.

112.title: Afghanistan needs India's help desperately: Taliban
112.article_body: Taliban militant Sirajuddin Haqqani said that Afghanistan "desperately" needs India's help, adding that India has a name in technology and trust in the international community that it fulfils its promises. "India has historical ties with Afghanistan. India had started some research and developmental programmes in Afghanistan...We want the unfinished projects...be...completed," he added.

113.title: We should be little kind to Hindi films: Alia on North vs South debate
113.article_body: Reacting to the North vs South debate, actress Alia Bhatt has said that it has been a tough year for Indian cinema. "We should be a little kind to Hindi films...Even in the South industry, all their films have not worked [this year]," she added. Alia further stated that a film with good content "always" does well.

114.title: Beyoncé to remove ableist lyric from new song 'Heated' amid backlash
114.article_body: Singer-songwriter Beyoncé has confirmed that she will change the lyrics of her new song 'Heated' which were called ableist and offensive by disability activists. The lyrics, co-written by Canadian singer Drake, have the line, "Spazzin' on that a**, spazz on that a**." "The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced," her statement read.

115.title: SC imposes ₹5 lakh fine on NGO over Noida's twin towers' petition
115.article_body: The Supreme Court asked an NGO to pay ₹5 lakh fine for filing a PIL seeking alteration of its year-old judgement directing demolition of Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The petition urged court to utilise the 40-storey towers for some "national cause" instead of demolishing. The court asked the petitioner to deposit the amount within four weeks.

116.title: Water supply in parts of Pune to be shut off on Thursday
116.article_body: The water supply in parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and repair work at the Parvati and Lashkar water stations. The water supply on Friday will be low pressure and delayed, Pune Municipal Corporation officials said. The areas which will get affected include Dattawadi, Rajendra Nagar, Mula Road, Koregaon Park, Wanawadi and others.

117.title: K'taka HC issues notices to Centre, state over detention of Sri Lankan citizens
117.article_body: Karnataka High Court has issued notices to the union and state governments over the alleged detention of Sri Lankan citizens in Bangalore Central Jail in Parappana Agrahara. A PIL has been filed on behalf of 25 persons claiming that the detention is illegal and a violation of human rights. It also seeks the transfer of the accused to detention centres.

118.title: Russia seeks to ban 'unfriendly' nations from adopting Russian children
118.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Monday tabled a bill in the lower house of the Parliament to ban the adoption of Russian children by citizens of "unfriendly" countries. If passed, the bill would expand a 2012 law that prohibits US citizens from adopting Russian children. Russia's list of unfriendly countries was expanded after several nations imposed sanctions on Moscow over Ukraine invasion.

119.title: Circulation of fake ₹2,000 notes decreased in banking system from 2018-19: Govt
119.article_body: The Union Ministry of Finance told Lok Sabha that circulation of fake ₹2,000 denomination currency notes has decreased in banking system from 2018-19. "In 2021-22, the number of fake currency notes of ₹2,000 denomination detected in banking system was 13,604 pieces which is 0.000635% of total number of banknotes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation," MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said.

120.title: Another monkeypox case reported in Kerala, India's tally reaches 7
120.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday informed that another monkeypox case was reported in the state, making it the fifth case in the state and seventh in India. The patient is a 30-year-old man who reached Kozhikode airport from UAE on July 27 and is currently undergoing treatment in Malappuram. Other two cases of monkeypox were reported in Delhi.

121.title: 2 women try to sell newborn girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai; arrested
121.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her associate were arrested for allegedly trying to sell a 15-day-old baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai. A member of Central Adoption Resources Authority received a tip-off about a woman who was looking for a buyer for the baby. He along with police tricked her into selling the babygirl to him and caught her red-handed.

122.title: Oil extends losses amid global demand concerns, manufacturing data
122.article_body: Oil prices on Tuesday extended the losses from the previous session with Brent crude futures falling 29 cents to $99.74 a barrel and WTI crude futures down 22 cents at $93.67 a barrel. The slide was driven by global oil demand concerns after weak manufacturing data in several countries. The Brent futures settled at $100.03 a barrel on Monday.

123.title: Murder accused ex-Army man, who acted in 28 films while hiding for 30 years, held
123.article_body: A murder accused, identified as Omprakash alias Pasha who earlier worked in the Indian Army's Signals Corps, has been arrested after 30 years. Pasha and his partner were booked in 1992 for allegedly stabbing to death a motorcyclist during a looting bid in Haryana. After the murder, Pasha started doing odd jobs, including acting in 28 regional and Bhojpuri films.

124.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 8.2% increase in sales in July
124.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India on Monday reported an increase of 8.28% in total sales to 1,75,916 units in July 2022 against 1,62,462 units in the corresponding period last fiscal. Domestic passenger vehicle sales rose by 6.82% to 1,42,850 units, the carmaker said, adding that the shortage of electronic components had a slight impact on the production of vehicles.

125.title: 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs to be oraganised in Delhi tomorrow
125.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said on Tuesday that the Culture Ministry is organising a 'Tiranga bike rally' for MPs of all political parties from Red Fort to the Parliament in Delhi tomorrow. He also urged all the MPs to join the rally at 8.30 am and stressed that the rally was organised by the ministry and not the BJP.

126.title: If you're not here to entertain me, go away: Kajol writes on Instagram
126.article_body: Actress Kajol recently took to Instagram Stories to share a seemingly angry and cryptic note. She wrote, "If you're not here to entertain me please go away and come back when you have some new material." This comes after Kajol marked 30 years in the film industry and shared a video montage of stills from her most notable projects.

127.title: Justin Bieber resumes world tour month after Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis
127.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber resumed his Justice world tour slightly over a month after his Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis. He shared pictures and videos from his performance in Italy at the Lucca Summer Festival on social media, writing, "Luv u guys and I missed you." Justin will be travelling to over 30 countries as part of his tour including India.

128.title: It took time to convince Harjinder to become a weightlifter: Coach
128.article_body: Talking about Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur who won a bronze medal at CWG 2022, her coach Paramjeet Sharma said, "It took some time to convince her to shift to weightlifting." "Sometimes Harjinder got carried away because of her own power," he added. Harjinder had earlier shared that the fodder she cut on a toka helped her build strong arms.

129.title: Not my money, was kept in my absence: Arpita on seized ₹50 crore
129.article_body: While reacting to the huge amount of cash seized from her flats, Arpita Mukherjee, ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's aide, on Tuesday said, "The money doesn't belong to me, it was kept there in my absence." Around ₹50 crore cash and jewellery were recovered from Mukherjee's two houses. Earlier, Chatterjee said the money doesn’t belong to him.

130.title: US used missile with 6 blades that slice through target to kill al-Qaeda chief: Reports
130.article_body: The US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) used the Hellfire R9X missile to eliminate al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, according to reports. Hellfire R9X is said to be a warhead-less missile equipped with six razor-like blades extending from the fuselage that slices through its target but does not explode. The missile has never been publicly acknowledged by the Pentagon or CIA.

131.title: Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well at CWG 2022: PM Modi
131.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has congratulated weightlifter Harjinder Kaur for winning the bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well [in] Birmingham...Continuing this, Harjinder [has won] a bronze," wrote PM Modi. Notably, out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

132.title: Kohli will remain in his original no. 3 place: Jaffer on T20 WC
132.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli should remain at his "original" number three spot in India's playing XI at the 2022 T20 World Cup. He added, "Rahul and Rohit should open...the aggressive approach that India has undertaken is very nice to witness. India's chances of winning (the WC) are bright." Kohli has been rested for the WI tour.

133.title: Ex-Sri Lankan Prez Gotabaya not getting any privileges: Singapore
133.article_body: Singapore Foreign Affairs Minister Vivian Balakrishnan said that former Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was not being accorded any privileges or immunity in Singapore. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka along with his wife on July 13 amid mass protests over his alleged mismanagement of the country's economy. He resigned as President after arriving in Singapore from the Maldives on July 14.

134.title: He needs no advice, he's magic & magician put together: Alia on SRK's flops
134.article_body: When asked what advice would she give to actor Shah Rukh Khan after few of his films flopped at the box office, actress Alia Bhatt said that he needs no advice. "He's the magic and magician put together. So I won't give any advice to him, rather I'll take advice from him on how magical he is," she added.

135.title: Reviving theatres not in our hand, viewers also responsible: Sudeep
135.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep, while reacting to shutting down of single-screen theatres in Karnataka, said reviving them is not in the industry's hand. "Reviving cannot happen with only one-hand clapping. One hand being...film industry...and...one big hand which can clap together, are...viewers," Sudeep said. He added people don't go to theatres thinking films will release on OTT platforms after some time.

136.title: Meeting Big B for 1st time was like meeting God, I was dumbstruck: KBC director
136.article_body: 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' director Arun Sheshkumar said that meeting actor Amitabh Bachchan for the first time was like meeting his God. "On October 11 every year, I would go and stand in front of his bungalow. The first time I met him, I was dumbstruck. He must have found me to be a low-confident guy," he added.

137.title: Don’t be brutal, time keeps changing for all: Uddhav Thackeray to BJP
137.article_body: Reacting to JP Nadda's statement that BJP would annihilate all regional parties and Shiv Sena was about to get finished in Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray said BJP shouldn't be so drunk on power. "Time keeps changing for everyone. You get back everything bad you do to others," he said. "BJP plot means dividing Hindus, crushing nativist and regional pride," he added.

138.title: Over 1,500 cattle die in Gujarat as lumpy skin disease affects multiple districts
138.article_body: The cattle death toll due to lumpy skin disease in Gujarat has reached 1,565, the state government said on Monday. The disease has spread in 2,083 villages across 20 districts and about 55,950 animals have been infected by the disease that spreads in cattle through blood-feeding insects. Mundra and Mandvi taluka are worst hit areas, a Gujarat Congress leader said.

139.title: IMD issues red alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains
139.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a 'red' alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains in the state. The 'red' alert has been issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Kasargod, where an 'orange' alert has been sounded for Tuesday and Wednesday. CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said six people have died amid heavy rains.

140.title: Was told 'You're too good looking,' star kids taken over looks: Karan Tacker
140.article_body: Television actor Karan Tacker has stated that he has faced rejection in the industry over superficial things like being "too good looking" and was told, "Don't be so fit". He called it hypocritical, saying that star kids are launched over their physicality. "Even with the best bodies, they will be playing roles that do not require bodies," the actor added.

141.title: Gogi gang sharpshooter arrested after encounter with police in Delhi
141.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell arrested an alleged sharpshooter belonging to Gogi gang following an encounter near Bhalswa Dairy in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused, Bhagwan Singh, also used to work for Lawrence Bishnoi who is accused in the murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, police added. Singh was injured in his left leg during the encounter.

142.title: 80 men arrested for gangraping 8 models shooting a music video in South Africa
142.article_body: More than 80 men suspected of gangraping eight models and armed robbery of a video production crew in the South African town of Krugersdorp were produced in court on Monday. "The crew of 12 women and 10 men were busy filming a music video when they were allegedly attacked by a group of armed men clad in blankets," police said.

143.title: Jaimangal was regularly meeting Assam CM, allegations false: BJP's Hazarika
143.article_body: Assam Minister Pijush Hazarika said that Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal is making fake allegations that three arrested MLAs had lured him to meet Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. Sharing pictures of Jaimangal with the Assam CM and Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, Hazarika said that Jaimangal has been constantly meeting Assam CM and met him five days before filing "fabricated FIR".

144.title: My films come after 4 yrs, trade changes in that time; I'm concerned: Aamir
144.article_body: Actor Aamir khan said that he is concerned because his movies release after four years. "Trade always changes in these four years. Don't know what will happen when my next film releases," he said, adding that films come on OTT platforms very fast. "I have always tried to keep a six months gap, at least for my films," he added.

145.title: Arsenic found in groundwater in 209 districts, uranium in 152: Govt
145.article_body: Arsenic has been found in the groundwater in parts of 209 districts in 25 states and Union Territories, Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Bishweswar Tudu, informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday. Uranium has been found in parts of 152 districts in 18 states, he added. Lead has been found in parts of 176 districts in 21 states, Tudu stated.

146.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo finishes 12th in men's 1000m time trial final at CWG 2022
146.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Laitonjam finished 12th in the men's 1000m time trial final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Ronaldo, who clocked 1:02.500 in the event, was 2.995 seconds behind gold medallist Matthew Glaetzer, who clocked 59.505. Ronaldo had earlier lost to Glaetzer in the pre-quarterfinals of the men's sprint event.

147.title: BJP seems unaffected by inflation, they’re thick-skinned people: Kharge
147.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said that when people across India are affected by inflation, BJP seems to be unaffected by it. "They are thick-skinned people," Kharge added. "We are ready to discuss the issue of price rise and have a consensus among us to keep the issue of inflation in the House," he stated.

148.title: MP Mahua keeps her ₹1.5 lakh Louis Vuitton bag down amid inflation debate in Lok Sabha
148.article_body: A video being widely circulated on social media showed TMC MP Mahua Moitra keeping her bag down, moving it from beside her to near her feet, once TMC member Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar raised the issue of inflation in Lok Sabha on Monday. As per reports, it was a Louis Vuitton bag priced at more than ₹1.5 lakh.

149.title: Rahul known for shallow politics, doesn't have serious knowledge of topics: Patra
149.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is known for "shallow politics". "You are never serious about politics. You don't have serious knowledge of topics," Patra added. His statement came after Rahul Gandhi criticised the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port. Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now, Patra stated.

150.title: Dia Mirza pens note for 25-year-old niece who died in car accident in Hyderabad
150.article_body: Dia Mirza has penned a note for her niece, Tanya Kakde, who died at the age of 25 in a car accident near Hyderabad on Monday. Dia wrote, "My niece. My child. My jaan. Gone into the light. May you find peace and love wherever you are my darling." She added, "You always brought a smile to our hearts...Om Shanti."

151.title: 3-month-old boy dies after vaccination in Odisha; case filed
151.article_body: A case has been filed after a three-month-old boy died last week after he was allegedly administered a faulty vaccine in Odisha's Jajpur, according to police. As per the complaint, the boy started crying uncontrollably and developed high fever after getting the vaccine and a pulse polio drop. The baby's body was exhumed and sent for autopsy, an inspector said.

152.title: Nothing to hide: Zomato CEO on Blinkit Founder's relationship with its executive
152.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said there was "nothing to hide" about the relationship between its Chief People Officer Akriti Chopra and Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa. The board was aware of it and Akriti was never involved in discussions relating to the ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, Goyal explained. Earlier, Zomato was criticised for not disclosing that the two executives are married.

153.title: Zomato shares jump nearly 18% after June quarter earnings
153.article_body: Zomato's share price surged around 18% in Tuesday’s early trade after the company came out with its June quarter earnings on Monday. The stock gained 18.44% to hit ₹54.90 apiece against its previous close of ₹46.35 on BSE. Zomato reported a net loss of ₹186 crore for the June quarter against a net loss of ₹356 crore a year ago.

154.title: Rapper Drake tests +ve for COVID, postpones Young Money Reunion show
154.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, rapper Drake has revealed that he has tested positive for COVID-19. He further wrote, "The Young Money Reunion show is being rescheduled to the SOONEST date possible." "I'm...sorry for letting you down on our weekend together and the moment I test negative, I will give you everything I got on stage (except COVID-19)," he added.

155.title: Family carries woman's body on cot for post-mortem in MP
155.article_body: A tribal woman's body was carried on a cot by her family to take it for post-mortem reportedly due to the absence of a hearse vehicle from the government in the Kehraha Tola area in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli. A police station in-charge said that the incident occurred as the area where the woman died is inaccessible to vehicles.

156.title: 3 youths molest woman for not giving way to their car in Pune; arrested
156.article_body: Three college students were arrested for allegedly molesting a woman during a road rage incident in Pune's Bavdhan on Sunday. The youths reportedly got angry as the woman didn't give way to their car despite them honking loudly, following which an argument broke out between them. They reportedly intercepted her vehicle and thrashed and molested the woman during the scuffle.

157.title: BMC to set up 3 new parking lots to decongest South Mumbai
157.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to set up parking facilities in three locations in South Mumbai to decongest these areas, a civic official said. The civic body has floated a tender for construction and maintenance of underground electro-mechanical car parking in the Fort area and two other robotic parking towers at Zaveri Bazaar and Matunga.

158.title: India likely to receive normal monsoon rains in August, September: IMD
158.article_body: The second half of southwest monsoon, from August to September is most likely to be normal for the country as a whole, IMD said on Monday. "Some deficiency may remain in Bihar, some northeastern states and other parts of the Indo-Gangetic plains," M Mohapatra, DG, IMD, said. "Above normal or excess rains are not expected for the region," Mohapatra added.

159.title: People say 'Are you PMSing?' To hell with you: Alia on sexism
159.article_body: Speaking about sexism, actress Alia Bhatt has stated that people say things like, 'Don't be so sensitive' and 'Are you PMSing?' "To hell with you, I am not being sensitive...You were born because women were PMSing," the actress added. She further stated that there is a certain understanding of how you should hide a lot of things as a woman.

160.title: Only similarity between 'Laal...' and 'PK' is innocence: Aamir Khan
160.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the only similarity between his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 2014 film 'PK' is the innocence of the lead characters. "The difference...you will see in the whole performance," the actor added. Earlier, social media users had pointed out similarities between the two films after watching the trailer of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

161.title: We'll only make 'Gorkha' when we're 100% right with the subject: Aanand
161.article_body: Speaking about 'Gorkha', filmmaker Aanand L Rai has said, "We'll only make the film when we feel that we are 100% right with the subject and we've cracked it well." The film was announced in October last year and will feature actor Akshay Kumar. "We're finding the right bound script and the process is on as we speak," he stated.

162.title: Pune girl slips, fractures leg at Kataldhar Waterfall; rescued
162.article_body: A female trekker from Pune was rescued after she slipped on a rock and fractured her leg at Kataldhar Waterfall in Lonavala. Another trekker had contacted the Shivdurg rescue team when the girl got injured. The rescue team reached the spot within one and a half hours and gave the girl first aid. The incident took place on Sunday.

163.title: A step towards a safer world: Trudeau on al-Qaeda chief's killing
163.article_body:
Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the death of al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri is a 
"step towards a safer world". "Canada will keep working with our global partners to counter terrorist threats, promote peace and security, and keep people here at home and around the world safe," Trudeau added. The al-Qaeda chief was killed in a US drone strike in Afghanistan.

164.title: Don't think we have many films like 'Raksha...' in B'wood: Akshay Kumar
164.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', actor Akshay Kumar has said that he has played many different roles in his career, however, he has never played a role that focuses on the sister-brother bond. "Actually, I don't think we have many such films in our industry. So in that sense, I got to try something new," he further added.

165.title: If you don't give opportunity, they'll never know: Rohit on Avesh bowling final over
165.article_body: Talking about Avesh Khan bowling the final over in the second T20I when WI needed 10 runs to win and Bhuvneshwar Kumar had two overs left, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It's all about giving opportunity." He added, "If you don't give opportunity to Avesh or Arshdeep, [they'll] never know what it is to bowl at death for India."

166.title: ITC Q1 net profit up 34% to ₹4,389.8 crore, revenue rises 39.2%
166.article_body: ITC Limited on Monday reported a 33.9% surge in consolidated net profit to ₹4,389.76 crore for the quarter ended June. Its revenue from operations during the said quarter rose 39.25% to ₹19,831.31 crore as against ₹14,240.76 crore a year ago. "Economic activity during the quarter gathered further momentum with an uptick in business and consumer sentiments," the Kolkata-headquartered company said.

167.title: I was made to feel worthless when I work my a** off: Janhvi on nepotism
167.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that she was made to feel worthless because she got opportunities in the film industry due to her parents Boney Kapoor and Sridevi. "I work my a** off to give it back to them for what they have done for me," the actress added. She further said that she feels overwhelming respect for her parents.

168.title: Heard explosion, people couldn't find way out: Hospital guard on MP fire
168.article_body: While talking about a fire that broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Ramkumar Patel, a security guard outside the New Life Multi-speciality Hospital near Damoh Naka, said that the fire started small but there was a "loud explosion". "Many people could not find a way out and died," Patel added.

169.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Hyderabad, over ₹5 lakh cash seized
169.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Monday busted a cricket betting racket and seized ₹5,91,820 in cash. Acting on a tip-off, a police team led by Inspector S Raghavendra raided a flat in Sulthan Bazar and arrested two accused persons who organised the racket and collected money from punters. According to police, one more suspect in the case is still absconding.

170.title: Assam to provide digital caste certificates to students
170.article_body: Assam government has launched ‘Mission Bhumiputra’, which aims to issue digital caste certificates to students across the state. The certificates will be available in the DigiLocker under the IT Act. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma inaugurated the Bhumiputra portal at a programme and lauded the mission. “Manual system of issuing caste certificates will be discontinued in Assam,” said Sarma.

171.title: Pune civic body to supply water via tankers for areas facing shortage
171.article_body: As the Baner, Balewadi, Pashan, Sus and Mahalunge areas in Pune are facing water supply problems, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to supply water in these areas using tankers until the supply problem is solved. "There has been sufficient storage in the dams...but improper planning of water distribution...has created water woes," former BJP corporator Amol Balwadkar said.

172.title: 1 man killed, 5 more wounded in shooting at apartment complex in US
172.article_body: One man was killed and five others were wounded in a shooting at an apartment complex in Northeast Washington on Monday night, the Metropolitan Police Department said. All the victims were adult males and those wounded were being treated at area hospitals. The circumstances of the shooting, including if the victims knew each other, were being investigated, police said.

173.title: France-based app developers sue Apple over app store fees
173.article_body: French app developers sued Apple on Monday accusing the latter of violating US antitrust law by overcharging them to use its app store. The complaint filed in a US court said that the iPhone maker abused its market monopoly over app distribution on iOS-based mobile devices by authorising only one app store. Apple is yet to comment on this.

174.title: Completely normal: Elon Musk's father on having 2 kids with his stepdaughter
174.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview said that it was "completely normal" for him to have two children with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout. He also reiterated, "The only thing we are on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol has a five-year-old son with Jana and had welcomed a daughter in 2019.
