175.title: PM Modi changes display pic on social media to Tricolour, asks Indians to do the same
175.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi changed the display picture on his social media accounts to Tricolour and urged all the Indians to do the same. "It's a special 2nd August today! At a time when we're marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, our nation is all set for #HarGharTiranga, a collective movement to celebrate our Tricolour," he said.

176.title: BJP’s nefarious intentions to topple my govt have failed: J'khand CM
176.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that BJP’s "nefarious intentions" to topple his government have failed. "We saw another example of BJP’s hunger for power...This is a big attack on our country’s democracy. Nor was I unsettled by their acts earlier, neither I am today," Soren added. Earlier, three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash in West Bengal.

177.title: MSRTC to introduce around 100 AC electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route
177.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to introduce around 100 new air-conditioned electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route by end of this year, an official of MSRTC said. These e-buses will have a seating capacity of 45 passengers and facilities like mobile charging sockets, emergency buttons, etc. The cost of one electric bus is approximately ₹1.6 crore.

178.title: T'gana woman throws daughter in water sump, pretends robbers killed her
178.article_body: A woman in Telangana's Jangaon reportedly threw her one-year-old daughter in a water sump and pretended that a chain-snatcher killed her. She was picked up by the police on suspicion of killing the child hours after she claimed that a man threw the baby in the sump after she resisted a robbery attempt. She later reportedly confessed to her crime.

179.title: Raj HC judgment on parole for having baby cannot be precedent: SC
179.article_body: The Supreme Court has stated that Rajasthan High Court granting parole to a convict for fathering a child cannot be cited as a precedent. The apex court was hearing the Rajasthan government's plea challenging HC's order and refused to intervene. However, it maintained that state governments and jail authorities can raise objections if any other convict seeks the same liberty.

180.title: 26-year-old crashes into car’s open door in Punjab, dies after truck hits him
180.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after being run over by a truck after his bike crashed into a car's open door in Punjab's Landran on Sunday evening. The deceased, Manjit Singh, and his injured co-worker Vikram Singh were on their way home after finishing their shift at an automobile service station in Landran when the incident took place.

181.title: Man lynched over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur
181.article_body: A Begusarai resident, Mushtakeen, was reportedly lynched by a mob over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur on the intervening night of Sunday-Monday. According to locals, three people were trying to steal oxen. They said that while two of them managed to escape, one was caught and killed by the mob, a video of which surfaced on social media.

182.title: Harshal Patel ruled out of 3rd T20I vs WI due to a rib injury
182.article_body: Team India pacer Harshal Patel has been ruled out of the third T20I against West Indies due to a rib injury. Harshal was also not available for selection in the second T20I, which India lost by five wickets. Leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi was dropped to include Avesh Khan in the second T20I. The third T20I will be played today.

183.title: Raj reports 1st suspected monkeypox case, patient admitted to Jaipur hospital
183.article_body: Rajasthan has reported its first suspected case of monkeypox after a 20-year-old, showing symptoms of the virus, was admitted to a government hospital in Jaipur. His samples have been sent to Pune's National Institute of Virology, an official said. The suspected monkeypox patient has been suffering from fever for four days and has rashes on his body, the official added.

184.title: Chhattisgarh's Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan to be renamed
184.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has instructed renaming of three places of historical significance in the state. The names of Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be changed. Chandkhuri will be known as Mata Kaushalya Dham Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri will be renamed as Baba Guru Ghasidas Dham Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be called Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh Dham Sonakhan.

185.title: Ram Gopal Yadav meets Yogi, SP says discussed minority issues
185.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ram Gopal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow on Monday. The meeting reportedly lasted for about half-an-hour. In a tweet after the meeting, SP said, "Talks were held in the context of persecution of backwards and Muslims across the state by filing false cases unilaterally."

186.title: Man with loaded AK-47 arrested outside Iranian journalist's US home
186.article_body: A man with a loaded AK-47 rifle was arrested outside the New York City home of an Iranian-American journalist who has been critical of Iran's regime. Masih Alinejad, who was the target of an alleged Tehran-backed kidnapping plot last year, said the Iranian government sent the man and is targeting her for giving voice to those being oppressed in Iran.

187.title: FBI releases 'deceased' poster of al-Qaeda chief who had $25 mn bounty on his head
187.article_body: The FBI has added 'deceased' caption under the profile picture of Ayman al-Zawahiri on its website and released an updated poster, after the Al-Qaeda chief was killed by the US in a drone strike in Kabul. The poster states that under the Rewards For Justice Program, al-Zawahiri had $25 million bounty on his head.

188.title: We'll start shooting 'Pushpa 2' after strike in Telugu industry ends: Producer
188.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' producer Y Ravi Shankar opened up about the shoot of the 2021 film's sequel. "We have a strike going on here in the Telugu industry. Once the strike is over, we'll start from August-end or whenever the strike is over," he said. Shankar further added that they are ready to shoot the Allu Arjun-starrer.

189.title: Indiscipline can't be excused: Rasquinha on India's 4-4 draw vs Eng at CWG
189.article_body: Discussing the 4-4 draw between the Indian men's hockey team and England at CWG 2022, ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha tweeted there were "harsh" umpiring decisions against the former. Rasquinha however added the indiscipline which led to three cards for the Indian team was "inexcusable". "Letting a 4-1 lead...slip in the final quarter...[was] poor [by India]," he stated.

190.title: One of my bigger problems was adjusting to India: 'Decoupled' actress Sonia
190.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Decoupled' and 'Broken But Beautiful 3', said one of her bigger problems was adjusting to India. "I spent my entire life in California and then...New York. So just coming here...understanding the way people worked, how Mumbai worked especially...was kind of my biggest challenge," she said, adding, "Now it has kind of become my home."

191.title: Oppn looking for 'mehengai' but it's not there: BJP's Jayant Sinha
191.article_body: BJP leader Jayant Sinha on Monday said there is no "mehengai" (inflation) and the Opposition has been looking for it but is unable to find it. "Look at it from the point of view of a common person, we have filled the 'thali' of the common person," Sinha added. "People are not feeling inflation because of PM's foresightedness," he stated.

192.title: 9 children die due to diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal's Tirap
192.article_body: At least nine children, aged between three and 10, have died due to a diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap in the last two weeks, officials said. The District Medical Officer said that the reason for the diarrhoea outbreak is yet to be ascertained. A medical team and an ambulance have been kept on standby at a community hall.

193.title: Couple solves 1.5L+ genetic hair fall cases with 93% success: Traya
193.article_body: Traya revealed that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hair fall. By combining tenets of Ayurveda, dermatology, and nutrition, the brand customizes a regime that aims to target factors like stress, sleep, poor nutrition, digestion which speed up balding. Users can take an online test to help them identify the cause of hair fall and treat it accordingly.

194.title: BJP is like fish out of water when not in power: Jharkhand CM
194.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren accused BJP of trying to destabilise his government, saying that BJP is like "fish out of water" when not in power. Examples of non BJP-ruled states are in front of you, he added. His statement comes after three Jharkhand Congress MLAs were arrested in West Bengal after unaccounted cash worth lakhs was recovered from them.

195.title: Sensex falls 171.8 points, Nifty down to 17,271 in opening trade
195.article_body: The benchmark indices opened marginally lower on Tuesday with the Sensex falling 171.83 points at 57,943.67, while the Nifty was down 68.50 points at 17,271.50. ITC, HUL, BPCL, Asian Paints were among the top Nifty gainers. Stocks of UPL, Eicher Motors, Hindalco Industries and Tata Steel slipped. The Nifty metal index lost 1% in opening trade.

196.title: 1 dead, 5 policemen injured as MP minister's pilot vehicle collides with car
196.article_body: A 60-year-old man died and seven others, including five policemen, were injured when the pilot vehicle accompanying Madhya Pradesh minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia collided with a car in Shivpuri on Monday. The deceased was sitting under a tree when the accident took place. The incident occurred near the Kali Pahadi area, about 65 kilometres from the district headquarters.

197.title: India reports 13,734 new COVID-19 cases, 16.5% less than yesterday
197.article_body: India has reported 13,734 COVID-19 cases, 17,897 recoveries and 34 deaths in the last 24 hours including seven reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,464 cases and 39 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,39,792, while the death toll reached 5,26,430.

198.title: 3rd West Indies-India T20I to start at 9.30 pm tonight instead of 8 pm
198.article_body: The third West Indies-India T20I in St Kitts will begin at 9.30 pm (IST) tonight instead of 8 pm, Cricket West Indies announced. "Following the delayed start on Monday...the teams have agreed to start the third T20I at a later time to ensure the players receive adequate rest and recovery time for the back-to-back matches in St Kitts," it stated.

199.title: Zomato defends ₹4,447 cr acquisition of Blinkit, CEO says 'no skeletons in closet'
199.article_body: Zomato has defended its ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, formerly Grofers. Addressing the criticism around the deal, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said, "We have zero skeletons in the closet." The deal was reached after an objective evaluation and Zomato "negotiated hard on valuation", he added. Goyal also said his relationship with Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa was "actually a good thing".

200.title: It would be 'odd' if I star opposite SRK, Salman or Aamir: Janhvi
200.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said it would be a little "odd" if she stars opposite actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, adding that she would love to work with them. Discussing her journey in Bollywood, Janhvi stated, "I have been made to feel that I...got things I don't deserve which means that I am technically worthless."

201.title: We want guys to be flexible: Rohit on different openers in T20Is
201.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked about the frequent changes in batting positions of players, said that the team wants batters to be flexible. "We want the guys to be able to bat anywhere and don't want them to be batting in specific positions," he explained. In the two WI T20Is, Suryakumar Yadav has opened alongside Rohit.

202.title: He is well built but he's eating badly: Elon's father on his shirtless pics
202.article_body: Reacting to Elon Musk's shirtless photos from Mykonos, his father Errol remarked that while the former is well built, "he’s been eating badly". In an interview, Errol said he had tried to recommend weight-loss supplements to Elon. He added that he still thought of Elon as a "little boy", even though he was over 50 now and "an old man".

203.title: Delhi bars, restaurants refuse to serve liquor over excise license expiry
203.article_body: Delhi bars and restaurants refused to serve alcohol after their excise licenses expired on July 31 over the state's rollback of its November 2021 excise policy. A restauranteur stated they incurred a ₹1-1.25 lakh loss and lost visitors to Gurugram and Noida. Delhi Lt Governor approved the state government's one-month extension of excise licenses of private liquor vendors on Monday.

204.title: What's the logic: Aamir on criticism over Mona Singh playing his mother in 'Laal Singh...'
204.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to criticism over 40-year-old Mona Singh playing the role of his mother in their upcoming film Laal Singh Chaddha. "What is the logic...It is the beauty of the actor to look any age on the screen despite their real age," Aamir said. "You are snatching away her good work. This is wrong," he added.

205.title: Cyclist Meenakshi gets run over by rival after high-speed crash at CWG, video surfaces
205.article_body: Indian cyclist Meenakshi was run over by New Zealand's Bryony Botha after a high-speed crash during the women's 10-km scratch race at CWG 2022. Meenakshi fell from her bike before sliding down the banking on the bend after which Botha ran over her. Meenakshi was stretchered off, while Botha also fell from her bike.

206.title: Yasin Malik ends hunger strike in Tihar Jail after 10 days
206.article_body: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik, who was on hunger strike in Tihar Jail, discontinued his fasting after he was told that his demands have been forwarded to the authorities concerned. Malik went on an indefinite hunger strike after the Centre did not respond to his request to allow him to physically appear in a Jammu court for an abduction case.

207.title: 6 dead amid Kerala rains; CM says 'There could be crisis if heavy rainfall continues'
207.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said that six people have died and one was missing amid heavy rains. "If this amount of rain continues...there could be a crisis," Vijayan added. As many as five houses have completely collapsed and 55 have partially collapsed. A 'red' alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Ernakulam and Idukki.

208.title: You won't okay first take, no: Chiranjeevi on Aamir's wish to do film with him
208.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan told actor Chiranjeevi he wants to do a movie with him. "Either I will direct or produce," Aamir said. "You won't okay the first take, no?" Chiranjeevi asked Khan, before also joking that he might end up giving 79 takes. Earlier, Khan had teased Chiranjeevi, saying he took actor Salman Khan for his film but not him.

209.title: Not happy with my performance: Harjinder after winning bronze at CWG
209.article_body: Following her bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur said she is "not happy" with her performance, though she is pleased about winning a medal. "I was confident...I will get a medal," she added. Harjinder's bronze medal has increased India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. She lifted a total weight of 212 kg.

210.title: Our stand is nationalism, there's no question of discrimination: K'taka CM
210.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said BJP is a national party which emphasises upon nationalism. "There's no question of discrimination against anyone," he added. Bommai's remarks came after Congress and JD(S) targeted him for not visiting the homes of two Muslim men who were killed in Dakshina Kannada, even though he met the family of murdered BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru.

211.title: Chandigarh constable suspended after hitting helmetless biker
211.article_body: A constable of Chandigarh Police was suspended on Monday after CCTV footage showed him hitting a biker riding without helmet with his baton. A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media. The complainant stated he was forced to tell doctors that he sustained his injuries after falling from his motorcycle when he was taken for medical examination.

212.title: Pak helicopter carrying Army General, other officers goes missing
212.article_body: A Pakistani military helicopter with six people on board, including an Army General, went missing on Monday, the army said. The helicopter was on a flood relief operation in Balochistan when it lost contact with air traffic control (ATC), it added. Calling the incident "alarming", PM Shehbaz Sharif said the entire nation is praying for the return of those onboard.

213.title: We nearly made a mess of this as well: Pooran after win in final over vs India
213.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said that "a win is a win" after they secured victory in the second T20I against India in the 20th over of their innings. "We lost a few close games and nearly made a mess of this as well," he stated. WI chased down India's 138-run total with only four balls remaining in the game.

214.title: Agra youth jumps into Yamuna river after failing to get govt job
214.article_body: A youth jumped into the Yamuna river after failing to secure a government job on Sunday night, police said. The man, who was a resident of Agra, was also preparing for army recruitment. Police stated that he left a note on his WhatsApp status before jumping into the river. A search is on to recover his body.

215.title: 2 people arrested for killing realtor in Hyderabad's Madhapur
215.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday arrested two men who may have fired upon and killed realtor Mohammed Ismail in Hyderabad's Madhapur. The two, identified as Jilani and Feroz, were nabbed on the outskirts of Hyderabad. However, the prime accused in the case, Mujahid, is currently on the run. According to police, there were property disputes between the accused and deceased.

216.title: Leaders from rival group shouldn't play with Shiv Sainiks' sentiments: Anita Birje
216.article_body: Shiv Sena's newly appointed deputy leader Anita Birje on Monday said that leaders from the rival group should not play with the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks, who will rise to the occasion if anyone tries to do so. "We will follow the path set by late Shiv Sena supremo Balasaheb Thackeray, with 80% social work and 20% politics," Birje added.

217.title: 3 police officers threaten lawyer, extort ₹9 lakh in Gurugram; held
217.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested three police personnel, including a special police officer, for allegedly extorting ₹9 lakh from a lawyer, officials said. The complainant claimed that he was at a guest house when at least five people, including the police personnel, arrived there, took him hostage, threatened to lodge a false case against him and demanded money.

218.title: Mumbai's madrassa teacher sold stolen mobiles in Nepal, Bangladesh; held
218.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man who is one of the seven gang members involved in auctioning stolen mobiles to resellers from Nepal and Bangladesh after changing the IMEI numbers. The accused had a bank account in Nepal and used to work as an Urdu teacher at a madrassa in Kurla. He was part of 43 WhatsApp groups.

219.title: Elon Musk is planning to build his own private airport in Texas: Report
219.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is reportedly planning to build his own private airport in Texas. As per the report, the airport will be used by Musk and his executives. Musk has based several of his companies, including SpaceX and The Boring Company, in Texas, and moved his Tesla headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas in December.

220.title: Pelosi has right to visit Taiwan, China needn't turn it into a conflict: US
220.article_body: The White House has warned China against turning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan into a "crisis or conflict", saying Pelosi "has the right to visit Taiwan". The White House also warned China might respond to Pelosi's mooted visit to Taiwan with military provocations, including by firing missiles near Taiwan. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

221.title: Love it when people think 'She's so dumb', memes add to my popularity: Alia
221.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she loves it when people think that she is unintelligent or that "Oh, she is so dumb". "They make so many memes on me which add to [my] popularity...I also want to put out this message for young girls...general knowledge and bookish intelligence in my opinion is not intelligence," she added.

222.title: In-laws harass woman for not giving birth to boy in Pune; FIR filed
222.article_body: Pune's Chinchwad police have filed an FIR against a 28-year-old woman's in-laws for allegedly harassing and molesting her for not giving birth to a boy, officials said on Monday. The woman rushed to police to file a complaint following an incident on July 29, wherein she was apparently grabbed by her hair, beaten, verbally abused and molested by her in-laws.

223.title: I don't take this seriously: Kareena on 'Boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
223.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of her upcoming movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Everyone has an opinion...if that is going to be there, then you have to learn to ignore certain things," she stated. Kareena added, "Otherwise, it'll...become impossible to live your life...that's why I don't take any of this like seriously."

224.title: I worked in many factories, tea stalls when I was young: Sudesh Lehri
224.article_body: Comedian Sudesh Lehri, recalling his childhood, revealed that he had circumstances when he was in poverty. "I used to work in small shops when I was young. I've worked in...many factories, tea stalls," he stated. Sudesh added he used to "quietly" have some tea before giving it to factory workers as there were days he couldn't have tea at home.

225.title: I've written to Tom Hanks if he's free & would watch 'Laal...': Aamir
225.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan revealed that he has written to Hollywood actor Tom Hanks if he would like to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The film is an official remake of Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "I've written to him if he's free...would like to watch the film. I have got feedback from his team that they're seeing his schedule for that," he stated.

226.title: Burglars drill hole in wall of jewellery shop in Pune, steal ornaments
226.article_body: Burglars stole gold ornaments worth ₹2.96 lakh by drilling a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri, police said. They entered the premises of a school, adjacent to the shop, and drilled a hole in the common wall, police added. The burglars also stole the digital video recorder in which the CCTV footage was captured.

227.title: Who was al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan?
227.article_body: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, 71, was a key architect behind multiple assaults on the US and was "deeply involved" in the planning of the September 11, 2001 attacks that killed 3,000 people. Born in 1951, he grew up in Egypt's upper-class neighbourhood. Zawahiri, a trained surgeon, became al Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

228.title: Suryakumar, Avesh wear Arshdeep’s jersey in 2nd T20I against West Indies, pics go viral
228.article_body: India cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Avesh Khan were seen wearing Arshdeep Singh's jersey during the second T20I against West Indies. This came after the match was postponed twice due to logistics issues, with luggage not arriving on time. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "How many extra jerseys does he have?" Another tweet read, "Why are everyone wearing Arshdeep's jersey?"

229.title: Partha Chatterjee not cooperating, often complaining of tiredness: ED
229.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said that ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the federal anti-money laundering agency in school job scam, has not been cooperating with sleuths. "He is often complaining of tiredness and avoiding our questions," an ED official told PTI. He remained silent most of the time during the questioning, the central probe agency added.

230.title: West Indies' McCoy breaks record for best-ever bowling figures against India in a T20I
230.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy has broken the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 to set the record. Prior to him, no bowler had even taken a five-wicket haul against India in T20I cricket. McCoy's figures against India are also the best-ever T20I figures by a West Indies bowler.

231.title: Who are India's gold medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
231.article_body: India's Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon will participate in women's discus throw final on Day 5 of CWG 2022. India will face Malaysia in gold medal match of badminton mixed team event at 10 pm. India's lawn bowls women's fours final match will begin at 4.15 pm. India's table tennis men's team gold match will begin at 6 pm.

232.title: Violation of withdrawal agreement: Taliban as US strike in Kabul kills al-Qaeda chief
232.article_body: After the US announced that it has killed Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri in a drone strike in Afghanistan over the weekend, Taliban condemned it as a violation of "international principles" and the 2020 agreement on US troop withdrawal. Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid said in a statement that the attack took place in Kabul on Sunday.

233.title: Air India brings new policy to allow pilots to fly till 65 amid fleet expansion
233.article_body: Air India has introduced a new policy wherein selected pilots will be given an extension of five years on a contract basis after their retirement amid the airline increasing number of aircraft in its fleet. While currently, the pilots retire at 58 at the company, the contract can be extended till the age of 65 years.

234.title: I have faced 'extreme misogyny' and 'casual sexism': Alia Bhatt
234.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she has faced "casual sexism" and "extreme misogyny" in the past, which has made her much more sensitive. "Sometimes my friends go like '...why have you become so aggressive?'" added Alia. "It's...just random things like 'don't be so sensitive'...are you PMSing. To hell with you...and even if I am PMSing so the hell what?" she stated.

235.title: Bengaluru reports 992 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
235.article_body: Bengaluru reported 992 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,37,060 cases in the city, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall death toll remained at 16,975. The number of active cases was 8,325, while the infection positivity rate stood at 7.45%.

236.title: Loudspeaker which rang everyday at 8 am has stopped: Maharashtra CM
236.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, without taking anyone's name, said the "loudspeaker" which rang everyday at 8 am is now stopped. "Hey, is...sound coming? Fix that loudspeaker. There'll be no sound," Shinde said. Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

237.title: Locals protest as minister says B'luru will be free of stray dogs
237.article_body: Weeks after Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu Chauhan said that Bengaluru will soon be free of stray dogs, locals held a protest at Freedom Park against the statement on Sunday. Calling the minister's claim misleading, Sujata Prasanna, a member of Action for Animal Justice, said there is no facility in the city that can accommodate lakhs of dogs.

238.title: Woman, 7-yr-old son returning from hospital run over by BEST bus, killed
238.article_body: A 27-year-old woman and her seven-year-old son were killed after being run over by a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport (BEST) bus on Monday. Woman had taken her son to Sion hospital as he was suffering from cold, fever and cough for last two days. Reports said the victims did not see bus as it took sudden turn on road.

239.title: Who won medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 4?
239.article_body: India won three medals on Day 4 of CWG 2022. Judoka Shushila Devi clinched a silver medal in the women's 48-kg category, becoming the first Indian to win multiple medals in judo in CWG history. Meanwhile, judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged bronze in the men's 60-kg category. Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category.

240.title: No matter where you hide, US will find you and take you out: Biden to terrorists
240.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "No matter where you hide, if you're a threat to our people, the United States will find you and take you out." He added, "We shall never waver from defending our nation and its people." Biden's statement came as he announced that Al-Qaeda's Ayman al-Zawahiri had been killed in a CIA drone strike in Afghanistan.

241.title: Estee Lauder in talks to acquire Tom Ford for $3 billion or more: Report
241.article_body: Cosmetics company Estee Lauder is in talks to acquire luxury brand Tom Ford in what could be a $3 billion or more deal, as per a report. If the deal goes through, it will be Estee Lauder's biggest acquisition ever. Tom Ford is known for its menswear and also has women's wear, cosmetics and handbags as part of its products.

242.title: Thane girl who scored 81.60% in SSC despite battling cancer passes away
242.article_body: Divya Pavale from Thane, who scored 81.60% despite battling cancer during her SSC exams this year, passed away on Monday evening. Reports said that Divya was undergoing chemotherapy even a few days before her practical exams. A trustee of her school said that she was a happy-go-lucky girl and was going through a difficult phase for last few days.

243.title: Delhi to launch mobile health check-ups for workers at construction sites
243.article_body: Delhi government has decided to set up mobile health check-ups and creche facilities for workers at construction sites. The 'Doctors on Wheels' scheme will arrange for mobile vans in every district to visit various construction sites for routine health check-ups, the government said. The mobile creches will be set up for children of construction workers at work sites, it added.

244.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 9 medals?
244.article_body: India have bagged a total of nine medals at CWG 2022 so far and are placed sixth on the medal standings after Day 4. Australia lead the standings with 31 gold medals, followed by England (21) and New Zealand (13). As many as 26 nations/territories have clinched at least one medal at CWG 2022 so far.

245.title: WI take all 10 wickets vs India in a T20I for 1st time in history, level series 1-1
245.article_body: West Indies defeated India by five wickets in the second T20I to level the five-match series 1-1. Bowling first, West Indies dismissed India for 138 runs in 19.4 overs. This is the first time in men's T20I cricket history that West Indies took all 10 wickets against India in an innings. West Indies chased down the target in 19.2 overs.

246.title: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan
246.article_body: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a drone strike by the US' CIA in Afghanistan on Sunday, President Joe Biden said. Zawahiri was a key plotter of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and took over as leader of the group after Osama bin Laden's death in 2011. "Justice has been delivered, and this terrorist leader is no more," Biden said.

247.title: Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bags bronze, wins India's 9th medal at CWG 2022
247.article_body: Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. Harjinder lifted a total of 212 kg, with 93 kg in snatch and 119 kg in clean and jerk. Out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

248.title: Defending champions India qualify for badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022
248.article_body: Defending champions India have qualified for the badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022. With this, India are assured of another medal. India defeated Singapore 3-0 in the semi-final of the event.  India will face Malaysia in the final on Tuesday. India have so far bagged eight medals at CWG 2022, including three gold medals.

249.title: India draw 4-4 vs England, concede 3 goals in 4th quarter in CWG men's hockey
249.article_body: Indian men's hockey team was held to a 4-4 draw against England in their second Pool B match at the Commonwealth Games on Monday. India were 4-1 ahead before England scored three goals in the fourth quarter. During the match, India reached a milestone of 100 goals in Commonwealth Games history following Mandeep Singh's goal in the 22nd minute.

250.title: Arunachal suspends residential proof certificates in Changlang
250.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh government on Monday issued an order suspending all residential proof certificates (RPC) issued in the Changlang district of the state. RPCs have been issued to members of the Chakma and Hajong communities who are yet to get Indian citizenship. This comes after students' body AAPSU threatened a strike over RPCs being issued to the two communities in Changlang.

251.title: Death toll due to floods in eastern Uganda rises to 24
251.article_body: The death toll due to the floods triggered by torrential rains in eastern Uganda reached 24 on Monday, authorities and Ugandan Red Cross informed. Uganda's government had confirmed 10 deaths due to the flooding in parts of Bugisu, Mbale and Kapchorwa on Sunday. 21 bodies have been recovered from Mbale and another three from Kapchorwa, Ugandan Red Cross told media.

252.title: Fintech startup Tartan raises $4.5 mn in pre-Series A round
252.article_body: Payroll management startup Tartan has raised $4.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round saw participation from 500 Global, InfoEdge Ventures, Naval Ravikant-backed AngelList Quant Fund, WorldQuant Ventures, Varanium GenNext Fund, 9 Unicorns, Yatra Angel Network, Emphasis Ventures (EMVC) and Naveen Kukreja. Tartan was founded in 2021 and has raised $6 million.

253.title: Inmates in Meerut jail make flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
253.article_body: Ahead of the 75th Independence Day, inmates of Meerut district jail have been making the national flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Jail superintendent Rakesh Kumar said that 30 male and 10 female inmates are making the flags. He further added that the national flag will be hoisted in all 39 barracks of the jail as part of the campaign.

254.title: TaxBuddy parent firm SSBA Innovations files ₹105 cr IPO papers
254.article_body: SSBA Innovations, which runs tax portal TaxBuddy, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI to raise ₹105 crore through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). As per the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP), the IPO will be an entirely fresh issue of shares. The fintech company was incorporated in 2017 and owns two platforms — TaxBuddy and Finbingo.

255.title: Sushila Devi's CWG 2022 silver can start a big movement: Charu Sharma
255.article_body: Following Indian judoka Sushila Devi's silver medal at Commonwealth Games 2022, commentator Charu Sharma tweeted, "India's northeast has massive martial arts potential in the lighter weights. Sushila Devi proves it with a rare silver in Judo. Could start a big movement." The 27-year-old from Manipur won silver in 48 kg category on Monday in Birmingham.

256.title: Elon feels he's behind schedule, is frustrated with his progress: Father Errol Musk
256.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has said that his billionaire son "feels like he's behind schedule", adding, "Where he is now, he would have liked to have been there five years ago." He added that the SpaceX CEO is "not as happy as he'd like to be", adding, "He is frustrated with (his) progress and it's understandable."

257.title: Kohli would be amazing to adventure with: Grylls on who he wants on Man vs Wild
257.article_body: On being asked who he would like to have on his show 'Man vs Wild', British adventurer Bear Grylls said, "Virat Kohli would be amazing to adventure with, a true heart of a lion and kind spirit." Grylls has earlier hosted Prime Minister Narendra Modi, actors Rajinikanth and Ranveer Singh and other Indian celebrities on the show.

258.title: Sri Lanka's Navy rescues 6 Indian fishermen stranded in its waters
258.article_body: Sri Lanka's Navy on Monday rescued six Indian fishermen after their boat developed a mechanical snag and drifted into the country's territorial waters. The Indian boat's owner was contacted by the Sri Lankan Navy, ANI reported. The owner then dispatched a rescue vessel from Rameswaram that brought back the stranded boat and its crew, the report added.

259.title: Ukraine confirms latest delivery of rocket systems from Germany, US
259.article_body: Ukraine's defence minister on Monday confirmed the latest delivery of German and US-made multiple rocket launcher systems to the country. Ukraine has received four HIMARS rocket launchers as part of the latest weapons aid, he said. He also announced on Twitter, "The third brother in the Long Hand family - MLRS MARS II from Germany - has arrived in Ukraine."

260.title: Nigerian man tests positive for monkeypox in Delhi, 6th case in India
260.article_body: A Nigerian man in his 30s has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, hospital officials said on Monday. This is the second case of the virus in the national capital and the sixth in India. The man had no recent foreign travel history, officials of the LNJP hospital, where he was admitted, said. India today confirmed its first monkeypox death.

261.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against West Indies
261.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I in St Kitts. India have made one change to their playing XI, with leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi being replaced by Avesh Khan. Meanwhile, West Indies have made two changes to their playing XI. The match was delayed due to logistics issues.

262.title: 28-year-old man dies in AC explosion in Chennai
262.article_body: A 28-year-old Chennai man died after an air conditioner exploded in his house on Sunday night. A loud noise was heard from the deceased's room on Sunday night, following which his father and brother rushed to the spot, reports said. They broke the door open and found the deceased's body inside the room, reports added.

263.title: Bill introduced in Aus parliament to lift ban on assisted suicides
263.article_body: A bill proposing the reversal of a ban on doctor-assisted suicide in two Australian territories was introduced in the country's parliament on Monday. It seeks to legalise assisted suicide in the Northern Territory and Australian Capital Territory. In 1995, Northern Territory became world's first place to legalise voluntary euthanasia. The law was later overturned in 1997 by Australia's parliament.

264.title: Vijay Kumar Yadav clinches bronze in judo, takes India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 8
264.article_body: Indian judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged a bronze medal in men's 60-kg category at CWG 2022. With this, he took India's medal tally at CWG to eight. It is India's second medal in judo at the ongoing games after Shushila Devi's silver. India have bagged three gold medals, three silver medals and two bronze medals at CWG 2022 so far.

265.title: Oppn raising issue of price rise due to Modi-phobia: BJP in LS
265.article_body: While defending the Central government over the issue of price rise, BJP on Monday asked the Opposition to get over "Modi-phobia", adding that people should appreciate PM Modi for his handling of the COVID-19 situation. BJP member Nishikant Dubey said India is the only country which is exporting rice, wheat and sugar under the leadership of PM Modi.

266.title: Delhi reports 822 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate highest in 6 months at 11.41%
266.article_body: Delhi reported 822 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Monday and the positivity rate rose to 11.41%, which is the highest in the last six months. The national capital also reported two deaths in the last 24 hours. Delhi saw 1,263 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, while the positivity rate stood at 9.35%.

267.title: Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now: BJP
267.article_body: The BJP on Monday criticised Rahul Gandhi for his criticism of the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port, adding that unlike in the past, drug consignments don't go undetected now. BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra also dubbed Gandhi a "vacation politician", alleging that the Congress leader doesn't go into the depth of any issue.

268.title: He'll remain at no. 3: Jaffer on Kohli's batting spot for T20 WC 2022
268.article_body: Talking about India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, beginning October 16, Wasim Jaffer said batter Virat Kohli will remain in his original number three spot. "KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma should open...other players like Rishabh Pant, Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan can contribute significantly to the squad," he added. Kohli has been rested for ongoing India-West Indies limited-overs series.

269.title: No need to create issue: Bihar minister as boy gets 151 out of 100 marks
269.article_body: After a college student in Bihar's Darbhanga was awarded 151 marks in a 100-mark paper, state Education minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary said it must have been a mistake and there was no need to create an issue. "There would be some misfeeding in the system or a typing error. We'll find out the person responsible for this," he said.

270.title: Bulgaria to hold snap poll on Oct 2; 4th parliamentary election in 2 years
270.article_body: Bulgaria's President Rumen Radev on Monday announced that the country will be holding an early parliamentary election on October 2. This comes following the collapse of former Prime Minister Kiril Petkov's coalition government after a no-confidence vote in June. The snap election will be Bulgaria's fourth parliamentary election in less than two years.

271.title: Shushila wins silver, becomes 1st Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in CWG history
271.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi on Monday became the first-ever Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). The 27-year-old clinched silver at CWG 2022 after losing to Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the women's 48-kg category final. Shushila had bagged a silver medal at CWG 2014.

272.title: India has sufficient forex reserves; economic fundamentals are perfect: FM
272.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India has sufficient foreign exchange reserves and India's economic fundamentals are perfect. Highlighting the strength of the Indian economy in the Parliament, Sitharaman said, "The government has acted to reduce cost of imports, drastically lowered duties on edible oils." No question of India slipping into stagflation or recession, she added.

273.title: India's Saurav Ghosal reaches men's singles semis in squash event at CWG
273.article_body: India's Saurav Ghosal entered the men's singles semi-final in the squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham. Ghosal beat Greg Lobban of Scotland 3-1 in the quarter-final match on Monday. The 35-year-old won with a scoreline of 11-5, 8-11, 11-7, 11-3. Ghosal will face New Zealand's Paul Coll in the semi-final on Tuesday.

274.title: India Accelerator announces new co-working space in Noida
274.article_body: India Accelerator, a startup accelerator, announced the launch of their new co-working space in Noida. The centre, spread across 20,000 sq. ft., has a capacity of 250 seats. The firm, which already has four co-working spaces in Gurugram has invested ₹2.75 crore in this space. The company said that within four years of its inception, it registered a 25x growth.

275.title: Income Tax Department sets new record as over 72 lakh ITRs filed in one day
275.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Monday said that a new record was set after taxpayers filed 72.42 lakh IT returns for FY22 on Sunday (July 31). About 5.83 crore ITRs for the financial year have been filed till July 31, the Department further said. The ITR deadline for salaried individuals wasn't extended for the first time in three years.

276.title: Indian economy better placed than most countries due to govt, RBI: FM
276.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Indian economy is better placed than most countries due to various measures taken by the government and the RBI. India remains the fastest growing economy in assessment of global agencies like International Monetary Fund and World Bank, Sitharaman said. Efforts are being made to bring down retail inflation below 7%, she added.

277.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I delayed again, to now start at 11 pm
277.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been delayed again and will now start at 11 pm (IST). The match, originally scheduled to begin at 8 pm (IST) was initially postponed by two hours because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad. India lead the five-match series 1-0.

278.title: Irani & daughter didn't own Goa bar, Congress leaders' claims malicious: Delhi HC
278.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that Union Minister Smriti Irani and her daughter Zoish never owned the Goa restaurant which Congress leaders alleged had an illegal bar license. It further said that the leaders' statements were "in the nature of slander...with malicious intent". The leaders were directed to remove the social media posts in which the allegations were made.

279.title: 7 tourists from Punjab drown in Himachal Pradesh's Gobind Sagar lake
279.article_body: Seven tourists from Punjab's Mohali drowned in the Gobind Sagar lake in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Monday. As per the State Disaster Management Department, a group of 11 tourists from Punjab entered the lake to take bath. Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur expressed grief over the incident.

280.title: Men's coach sits for Indian women's TT team match at CWG, sparks controversy
280.article_body: A controversy erupted after men's coach S Raman sat for Indian women's TT team quarter-final match against Malaysia at CWG 2022. "This shouldn't have happened, women's coach should've been guiding...players," said SD Mudgil, member of the Committee of Administrators running the suspended TTFI. After their defeat, the women's team also avoided media interaction, which is a standard protocol.

281.title: Efforts on to misuse central agencies to silence truth: Rahul on Raut's arrest
281.article_body: Efforts are on to misuse central agencies to break Opposition's morale and to silence the truth, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said while reacting to Enforcement Directorate's arrest of Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut. "'King's' message is clear - those who speak against me will suffer...But the tyrants must listen. In the end, 'truth' will win and ego will lose," Gandhi tweeted.

282.title: Kerala Startup Mission-backed Alibi gets NABL accreditation
282.article_body: Private forensics lab Alibi Global Private Limited, backed by Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM), has received accreditation from the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL). The accreditation is for a period of two years, according to a KSUM press release. The startup, which works exclusively in cyber forensics, is the first cyber forensics private lab in India.

283.title: Tribal areas in Himachal saw unprecedented growth under BJP: CM
283.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said that the tribal and hard areas of the state saw unprecedented growth under the BJP government. Addressing a delegation of the Bharmour-Pangi area, he said that the state government made adequate budget allocation for tribal and backward areas. He alleged that the Congress government used the tribal people as a vote bank.

284.title: UP woman throws baby in front of tractor to stop it amid dispute
284.article_body: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda threw her baby in front of a tractor. The driver averted the mishap and stopped the tractor right in time. The incident occurred over a property dispute between two brothers and one tried to plough the other's field and claim possession. To avoid this, the wife of one of the brothers threw her infant.

285.title: NZ cyclist Ellesse stripped of CWG silver medal for not attending ceremony, fined ₹16,000
285.article_body: New Zealand cyclist Ellesse Andrews has been stripped of her silver medal that she bagged along with her teammates in the women's 4,000m team pursuit event. She won't get the medal as she did not attend the ceremony. She was also fined CHF 200 (more than ₹16,000). However, she went on to win two gold medals in two other events.

286.title: TN Police to engage IT students for cyber crime investigation
286.article_body: The Coimbatore Police will join hands with IT students, who are specialising in artificial intelligence and ethical hacking for the investigation of cyber crimes. The police have also planned to establish a 'Cyber Club', which will be used to create cyber awareness among common people. The club will educate common people about how to stay away from modern cyber crimes.

287.title: African swine fever reported in 2 districts of Kerala
287.article_body: New cases of swine fever were reported in Kerala's Wayanad and Kannur districts, district officials said. One case each has been reported in the districts and the Kannur District Collector scheduled a meeting. The Deputy Director of Animal Husbandry in Wayanad said that 193 pigs in and around Nenmeni village, where the disease was reported, will be culled this week.

288.title: Buy only 'Made in India' flags: Pune foundation to citizens
288.article_body: Volunteers of the Bharat Flag Foundation in Pune are asking citizens to not use China-made Indian flags over those made locally. Pamphlets were given to residents and shopkeepers, and they were asked to celebrate Independence Day using 'Made in India' flags. Purchasing these flags would indirectly support the Chinese economy, said Rahul Bhalerao, Executive President of the Foundation.

289.title: Pune district sees highest COVID-19 jab 1st dose coverage in Maha
289.article_body: Pune district reported 106.05% of the first COVID-19 vaccine dose coverage in Maharashtra, which is the highest in the state. State immunisation officer, Dr Sachin Desai, said initiatives like Har Ghar Dastak and free booster vaccination for 18 years and above have urged people to get immunised. Pune has the second highest second dose coverage across the state at 90.67%.

290.title: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finishes 5th in women's vault final at CWG
290.article_body: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finished fifth in women's vault final with an average score of 12.699 at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Pranati scored 13.633 in her first attempt and 11.766 in her second. Australia's Georgia Godwin won a gold medal after scoring 13.233 points. Canada's Laurie Denommee won silver, while Scotland's Shannon Archer won bronze.

291.title: ED's 8-yr record shows its targeting only Oppn leaders: CM Baghel
291.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said the track record of the ED in the last eight years showed it was only targeting leaders of Opposition parties. "It is clear those who will speak against the Centre will face action. The agency never takes action in BJP-ruled states or against its leaders or BJP-supported organisations," CM Baghel said.

292.title: India's squash player Joshna Chinappa loses in quarter-final at CWG
292.article_body: India's Joshna Chinappa lost in the women's singles quarter-final against Canada's Hollie Naughton 0-3 in the squash event at CWG 2022 in Birmingham. She lost with a scoreline of 9-11, 5-11, 13-15 on Monday. Chinappa has never won a gold medal in singles event at CWG. She won a gold with Dipika Pallikal in women's doubles at CWG 2014.

293.title: Woman gangraped & filmed at rehab centre, forced into prostitution in Rishikesh
293.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped by two men at a drug rehabilitation centre in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh, as per a police complaint. The woman who runs the centre allegedly filmed the assault and blackmailed the complainant using the video to force her into prostitution. Police have filed a case and an investigation is underway.

294.title: Absolutely no chance of India going into recession: Finance Minister
294.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during a price rise debate in Parliament said there is "absolutely zero probability of India slipping into recession" or stagflation. "Pandemic, [COVID-19] second wave, Omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...in spite of [all this], we've held inflation within 7% or below. That has to be recognised," said Sitharaman. The Indian economy has recovered admirably, she said.

295.title: Congress MPs walk out of Lok Sabha as FM Sitharaman speaks on rising prices
295.article_body: Congress MPs walked out of the Lok Sabha as Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke on rising prices on Monday. "Pandemic, second wave, omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...even today largest supply components in China are under lockdown...in spite of that, we have held inflation well within 7% or below," she said. Sitharaman added that this has to be recognised.

296.title: RIL-owned logistics startup Grab.in integrates with ONDC
296.article_body: Reliance Retail owned logistics startup Grab.in has joined its platform with the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) network, a senior executive at the company said. The e-commerce platform is a subsidiary of Reliance Retail since its acquisitions by Reliance Industries in 2019. Prior to this, Reliance-backed Dunzo joined ONDC as a logistics partner.

297.title: US House Speaker Pelosi will visit Taiwan despite Chinese warnings: Reports
297.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi will visit Taiwan during her Asia tour, despite Chinese warnings, US media reported on Monday. The visit is definite, the Wall Street Journal reported, quoting a person familiar with the matter. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if the top US official visits Taiwan, which it considers its own territory.

298.title: Made a mistake, forgive me: Maha Guv on 'Gujarati-Rajasthani' remark
298.article_body: Following criticism over his Gujarati-Rajasthani remarks, Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said, "I have made a mistake." Last week, he had said, "If Gujaratis and Rajasthanis are removed from Maharashtra...no money would be left here." "I don't even imagine that if I made any mistake unintentionally...that mistake would be considered as an insult to...Maharashtra," he added.

299.title: Who were the top bidders as govt sells 5G spectrum for over ₹1.5 lakh crore?
299.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction concluded on Monday after seven days, with a total bid amount of ₹1,50,173 crore. Reliance Jio emerged the top bidder, acquiring 24,740 MHz spectrum worth ₹88,078 crore. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore. Vodafone Idea's bid was worth ₹18,799 crore, while Adani Group acquired 400 MHz spectrum worth ₹212 crore.

300.title: Indian IPO market for tech startups is nascent: Lightspeed's Somaia
300.article_body: Venture capital firm Lightspeed's de facto head of India operations, Bejul Somaia, in an interview said the IPO market for Indian tech companies is still nascent. Calling last year's tech IPOs a positive development, he said that the market still needed to deepen. With companies like Udaan, OYO, Razorpay, etc in its portfolio, Lightspeed recently closed a $500 million fund.

301.title: Centre forms special task force to monitor monkeypox cases
301.article_body: The Centre has formed a special task force to monitor monkeypox cases, officials said. The task force, which will be headed by NITI Aayog member (health) VK Paul, will also coordinate cases from states and provide any expertise that the states need. A 22-year-old man who had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE died in Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday.

302.title: ED took action against Raut based on evidence: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
302.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said the ED's action against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was based on certain proofs and documents. "I would not comment on this issue further. His arrest and other related issues will be discussed in the court," said Fadnavis. Raut was arrested on Sunday night in connection with the Patra Chawl scam case.

303.title: TMC MP bites raw brinjal during Parliament debate on price rise, video released
303.article_body: TMC MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar on Monday bit on a raw brinjal during a Parliament debate on price rise. A video of the incident was released online, in which she's heard saying, "I'm talking about eating raw vegetables because LPG cylinder [price] has risen four times in four months." Government must understand what citizens are going through, she said.

304.title: Indian squash player Kuruvilla enters women's singles plate semis at CWG
304.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Sri Lanka's Chanithma Sinaly 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Kuruvilla won the quarter-final match with a scoreline of 11-3, 11-2, 11-2. The 23-year-old will face Pakistan's Faiza Zafar on Tuesday. Zafar beat Guyana's Ashley Khalil 3-2 in the quarter-final.

305.title: Amber sells her home in US' California for $1.05 mn to pay Johnny Depp: Reports
305.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has reportedly sold her home in US' California after losing a defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp in which she was ordered to pay him $8.3 million in damages. The property in Yucca Valley has been sold for $1.05 million (around ₹8.3 crore), reports said, adding that she bought it in 2019 for $5,70,000 (around ₹4.5 crore).

306.title: Have taken various steps to make India 'global drone hub' by 2030: Govt
306.article_body: The government has undertaken a series of reform measures to make India a global drone hub by 2030, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said on Monday. Singh added that the Drone Airspace Map was published on September 24, 2021, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet.

307.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
307.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

308.title: Zomato's consolidated loss nearly halves to ₹186 cr in Apr-Jun quarter
308.article_body: Zomato's consolidated net loss fell 47.8% YoY from ₹356.2 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹185.7 crore in Q1 FY23. Zomato's consolidated revenue stood at ₹1,413.9 crore, rising by 67.44% YoY from ₹844.4 crore. Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal said growth in the food delivery platform's revenue was driven by a nearly 10% quarter-on-quarter growth in gross order value.

309.title: K'taka govt issues circular to check spread of monkeypox infection
309.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Sudhakar K on Monday said a circular has been issued to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and all district administrations as a precautionary measure to check the spread of monkeypox infection. As per the circular, authorities have been asked to ensure enhanced surveillance, designated institutional isolation facilities, mandatory contact tracing and testing of samples.

310.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
310.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

311.title: There was never a minute when I had headache as Delhi Police chief: Asthana
311.article_body: Former Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana has said that there was never a minute when he had headache and wanted to quit the force. "Although I've retired today, I still believe I can do a lot more for the Delhi Police, the people and the country," he added. Senior IPS officer Sanjay Arora took charge as the new Commissioner.

312.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I postponed by 2 hours as team luggage doesn't arrive on time
312.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been postponed by two hours and is now scheduled to begin at 10 pm tonight, instead of 8 pm at Warner Park in St Kitts today. Cricket West Indies (CWI) said that the match has been postponed because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad.

313.title: Video of Paytm employees burning PhonePe's QR codes surfaces, police complaint lodged
313.article_body: UPI leader PhonePe filed a police complaint against some employees of Paytm, alleging that they burnt PhonePe's QR codes. The incident is said to have taken place in Greater Noida. A video of the incident has surfaced online. PhonePe said that it identified three Paytm employees, including an ex-PhonePe employee. Paytm said it suspended the employees pending a detailed investigation.

314.title: Raut is the Shiv Sainik who won’t bend: Uddhav on Raut’s arrest
314.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that he's proud of Sanjay Raut, adding that he's a real Shiv Sainik who won't bend. “There’s a dialogue in ‘Pushpa’ - “jhukega nahi”. Those who used to say they won’t bend are all that side today.” he said. Thackeray criticised the BJP for trying to muzzle the voices of dissent.

315.title: Delhi man intensifies crime to buy scooter for sister on Raksha Bandhan
315.article_body: A 21-year-old history-sheeter allegedly intensified his criminal activities in Delhi, so that he could buy an electric scooter for his sister on Raksha Bandhan, police said on Monday. With the accused's arrest, police claim to have solved six criminal cases, and also recovered three stolen mobile phones and a motorcycle from him.

316.title: B'luru to see regular power cuts in August due to maintenance work
316.article_body: Bengaluru is expected to witness regular power cuts throughout August due to maintenance work by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited. According to Bengaluru's power distribution company BESCOM, the work will be undertaken nearly every day of the month from 9 am to 6 pm. As per BESCOM, its Koramangala, Indiranagar, Kanakapura and Whitefield divisions, among others, will be affected.

317.title: Teen dies after drowning in swimming pool in Hyderabad's Narsingi
317.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died on Sunday after drowning in a swimming pool at a gated community in Hyderabad's Narsingi, police informed. According to police, the boy was pulled out of the pool by his cousin who saw him struggling in the water on Saturday when they visited the pool. The teenager was later hospitalised but died during treatment, police added.

318.title: Realtor shot dead by business associate in Hyderabad's Madhapur
318.article_body: A real estate dealer named Mohammad Ismail was allegedly shot dead by his business associate over a suspected property dispute in Hyderabad's Madhapur area during the early hours of Monday. Police found in its preliminary probe that both the victim and the accused had several criminal cases registered against them. The accused and his associate are absconding, police said.

319.title: Bengaluru reports 1,154 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.3%
319.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,154 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 7.31% on Sunday, data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath said. As per the data, no new deaths were recorded due to the infection in the city on Sunday. Bengaluru's active case count stands at 8,595, data showed.

320.title: The more I bowled spin, the more I looked at Muralidaran: Narine
320.article_body: KKR spinner Sunil Narine revealed that he used to look up to Sri Lankan spinner Muthiah Muralidaran when the former was starting out his career as a spin bowler. "The more I bowled spin, the more I looked to Muralidaran...he had the ball going both ways. But in the beginning, it was tough [in West Indies]," Narine said.

321.title: 2nd seed Sinner beats top seed Alcaraz to win 1st title of 2022 in Croatia
321.article_body: Second-seeded Jannik Sinner beat top-seeded Carlos Alcaraz 6-7(5-7), 6-1, 6-1 to win Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Sunday. It was the 20-year-old's first title of the season. "I'm obviously very happy. I have (had) a tough year until now," said Sinner. The win was the Italian's second against Alcaraz in four weeks. Overall, it was Sinner's sixth title.

322.title: Google Maps to share speed limit info with users in B'luru, Chandigarh
322.article_body: Google Maps will now display speed limit information to its users in Bengaluru and Chandigarh as part of a partnership between Google and the traffic police departments of Bengaluru and Chandigarh. Google will reportedly extend the pilot project to Kolkata and Hyderabad in the coming months. The project has already reduced 20% wait time for commuters, Bengaluru traffic police said.

323.title: Judoka Shushila Devi assures India of another CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
323.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi has assured India of another medal at the ongoing Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. She defeated Mauritian judoka Priscilla Morand by IPPON in the semi-final of the women's 48-kg category to reach the final. She will face Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the gold medal match after 9.30 pm (IST) tonight.

324.title: Tesla CEO Musk says engagement on Twitter has dropped recently
324.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said interaction with almost all Twitter accounts "seem to be much lower in recent weeks and days". Musk asked in a tweet if users think his analysis is "accurate". Reacting to Musk's tweet, a user wrote, "Nah, Elon. We're just actively ignoring you." Another user wrote, "It's because markets have been down. It'll come back."

325.title: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction ends, total bids cross ₹1.5 lakh crore
325.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction has concluded, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Monday. The total bid amount for the sale of airwaves was over ₹1.5 lakh crore at the end of the auction. Out of the 72 GHz of the spectrum that was put up for auction, around 51 GHz has been sold, Vaishnaw said.

326.title: Death toll in fire at Madhya Pradesh hospital rises to 9
326.article_body: At least nine people died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Superintendent of Police (SP) Siddharth Bahuguna said. Two injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment. The SP said prima facie, it appears that a short circuit caused the blaze. The fire has been doused.

327.title: He would cry for meat, but we couldn't afford it: Mother of CWG gold medallist Achinta
327.article_body: After Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged gold medal for India at CWG 2022, his mother Purnima said, "If one day he had rice on his plate, then he would not have any vegetables with it." She added, "Some days it would be eggs, while meat was something my son would cry for, but we could not afford it."

328.title: Pune Police rolls back guidelines for Ganesh Chaturthi festival
328.article_body: The Pune Police has rolled back its guidelines for the upcoming 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, three days after issuing them. "Considering the demands raised by Ganpati mandals, we will soon issue fresh guidelines for this year's Ganpati festival," said Pune Police Joint Commissioner Sandeep Karnik. Earlier, only two box 'kamans' were permitted per Ganpati mandal in the city.

329.title: Amit Panghal enters quarterfinals in flyweight category at CWG 2022
329.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri to enter the quarterfinals in the men's 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday. Panghal won the round of 16 in a unanimous decision (5-0). The 26-year-old will next face Scottish boxer Lennon Mulligan in the quarterfinals.

330.title: Sanjay Raut tampered with evidence: ED in its 8-day custody plea
330.article_body: Seeking eight-day custody for Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, the ED in its plea said that Raut was tampering with evidence and influenced several crucial witnesses in the money laundering case. ED was granted custody of Raut till August 4, who was arrested on Sunday night in a money laundering case related to the Patra Chawl land scam case.

331.title: Andhra ex-CM NTR's daughter Uma found dead at her Hyderabad home
331.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder and former CM of Andhra Pradesh NT Rama Rao's (NTR's) daughter Uma Maheshwari was found dead at her residence in Hyderabad on Monday. Uma was the youngest among actor-turned-politician NTR's 12 children. Her body has been shifted to a local hospital for postmortem, reports said.

332.title: Delhi BJP leaders sit on dharna outside Kejriwal's home
332.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders sat on a dharna outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home demanding that Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and minister Satyendar Jain be removed over charges of alleged corruption. Jain is currently in judicial custody in a case of alleged money laundering registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). Kejriwal was in Gujarat to address a public rally in Rajkot.

333.title: MP CM announces ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh for families of 4 killed in hospital fire
333.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each for the families of four people who died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Jabalpur. At least three other people were seriously injured in the fire. The fire began at the entrance of the hospital located near Shiv Nagar Damoh Naka.

334.title: Uddhav backs Sanjay Raut, calls him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’
334.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s arrest, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray criticised BJP and claimed that the saffron party is trying to muzzle voices of the dissent. "Using CBI, ED and other agencies to repress dissent is not democracy,” said Uddhav. He further added that he is proud of Raut and called him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’.

335.title: China warns its military 'won't sit idly' if Pelosi visits Taiwan
335.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry, during a regular briefing, has said that its military "won't sit idly" if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. A spokesperson of the ministry said that due to Pelosi's status as "No 3 official of US government", a visit to Taiwan would "lead to egregious political impact". This comes as Pelosi began an Asian tour.

336.title: Boeing to develop research facility in Japan to develop sustainable fuel
336.article_body: Boeing will establish a research and development centre in Japan with an aim to further develop sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). In a news release, US aircraft manufacturer said that the facility will focus on robotics, digitalisation and automation. Sustainable aviation fuel uses feedstock like animal fat and cooking oil which is more expensive than conventional jet fuel.

337.title: 20 quarantined in Kerala after youth dies of monkeypox
337.article_body: Following the death of a person due to monkeypox in Kerala, 20 people have been put under quarantine in Thrissur. “The situation is under control, there's no panic here. The deceased had direct contact with 10 people including the family members,” officials said. Meanwhile, the Centre formed a task force on monkeypox to closely monitor the situation in the country.

338.title: 126 Venezuelan migrants including 9 women deported from Mexico
338.article_body: Mexico has deported 126 Venezuelan migrants, including nine women, who were not able to prove their legal entry, the country's National Migration Institute said in a statement. The migrants boarded a flight early Saturday, it added. According to the UN, over six million Venezuelans have fled from their home country to escape violence as well as lack of essential services.

339.title: Holiday for educational institutions in parts of Kerala amid rains
339.article_body: A holiday has been declared for educational institutions in parts of Kerala on Monday amid heavy rainfall. District Collectors of Pathanamthitta and Kollam declared August 1 as a holiday for educational institutions in certain taluks in their respective districts. In Ernakulam, all departments have been directed to be prepared and fishermen have been instructed not to venture into the sea.

340.title: Shooting while pregnant was quite a task: Alia on 'Heart of Stone'
340.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone', actress Alia Bhatt said that she had quite a task at hand since she was pregnant during the shoot. She added that there were many layers for her to deal with due to her pregnancy. "But they made it so seamless and so easy and so comfortable for me," Alia said.

341.title: Gambhir asked me to open, opposition didn't take me seriously: Sunil Narine
341.article_body: Talking about his batting, West Indies spinner Sunil Narine said he was first tried out as an opener in BBL, and then Gautam Gambhir asked him to open for KKR in IPL 2017. "Gambhir wanted me to get the team off to a fast start...opposition didn't take me that seriously...[but] I went from strength to strength," added Narine.

342.title: Dalit woman sexually harassed, forced to undress at gunpoint in UP; 7 arrested
342.article_body: A 30-year-old Dalit woman was allegedly sexually harassed and forced to remove her clothes at gunpoint in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The miscreants also recorded the act on a mobile phone camera, police said. The matter came to the fore after the incident's video was circulated on social media. Police arrested seven persons in connection with the incident on Sunday.

343.title: National Awards jury members are just Bollywood fans: Adoor Gopalakrishnan
343.article_body: Filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan has stated that now the National Awards jury comprises anonymous Bollywood fans "playing...jokes". He further said that earlier the jury consisted of well-known directors, theatre artists and critics. "[Now] some random person becomes the chairman of the jury that gives awards to some people...everyone knows the exact reason (why they got the awards)," he added.

344.title: 1st ship carrying Ukrainian grain since war began leaves Odesa
344.article_body: A ship carrying Ukrainian grain left the port of Odesa on Monday, the first departure since the Russian invasion blocked shipping. This comes after Russia and Ukraine signed separate agreements with Turkey and the UN to resume Ukrainian grain export. "It's important for us to be one of the guarantors of food security," Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said.

345.title: 169 dengue cases so far this year in Delhi, highest since 2017
345.article_body: Nearly 170 dengue cases have been reported in Delhi this year till July 30, the highest for the period since 2017, according to a civic body report released on Monday. In 2015, Delhi witnessed a massive outbreak of dengue, with the number of cases crossing 10,600 in October alone. It was Delhi's worst dengue outbreak since 1996.

346.title: It was our worst performance: Pooran on WI's 1st T20I loss vs India
346.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran called his side's first T20I loss against India as the worst performance. "We knew something like this was going to happen," he added. Chasing 191, West Indies managed to score 122/8 in 20 overs. With 20 runs off 15 balls, Shamarh Brooks was the top-scorer for West Indies. India beat West Indies by 68 runs.

347.title: Centre taking steps to make India global drone hub by 2030: VK Singh to RS
347.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha on Monday that the Centre has undertaken various steps to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Replying to a query, Singh said, "Drone Airspace Map was published...last year, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as a green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet."

348.title: DeHaat fires employees less than a year after raising $115 million
348.article_body: DeHaat has laid off 500 employees less than a year after securing $115 million in the largest funding round for an Indian agritech startup, Moneycontrol reported. Responding to the report, DeHaat CEO Shashank Kumar said that the number of employees affected is not in triple digits. "It was a corrective measure around performances and due to culture misfit," Kumar added.

349.title: Massive fire breaks out at MP hospital, 4 killed & 3 seriously injured
349.article_body: At least four people have died in a massive fire that broke out at a private hospital in MP's Jabalpur on Monday. An official said that at least three other people were seriously injured in the fire and that operations to save those trapped in the fire were underway. A short circuit could be the fire's cause, the official said.

350.title: Woman narrates atmosphere of football stadium to visually impaired son in Brazil
350.article_body: A video showing a woman describing the atmosphere of a football stadium before a match to her visually impaired son in Brazil has gone viral. "Son, there are flags over there...lots of Avaí fans, back here there are Flamengo fans," the woman is heard saying in the video. "We are behind the goal. Do you understand, my love?" she added.

351.title: 25-yr-old daughter of Congress leader Feroz Khan dies after car hits divider in T'gana
