351.article_body: Congress leader Feroz Khan's 25-year-old daughter Tanya Kakde died in a road accident in Telangana's Shamshabad. Tanya was travelling with her friends to Hyderabad when her car hit a road divider. "She was immediately shifted to Osmania Hospital, where the doctors declared her brought dead," police said. A case has been registered.

352.title: 15-year-old girl beheads her 9-year-old relative with a sword in Rajasthan
352.article_body: A 15-year-old girl beheaded her nine-year-old niece with a sword in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district, with her family saying that she wasn't "behaving normally" for two days. As per police, the attack happened on Monday morning when the Class 10 girl and her family were performing puja at their home. The body of the victim has been sent for post-mortem.

353.title: Varun wraps Nitesh's 'Bawaal' in Poland, film to release in April 2023
353.article_body: Varun Dhawan has finished filming for his upcoming movie 'Bawaal' in Poland, the actor announced on Monday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video announcing the wrap and shared that the film, being directed by Nitesh Tiwari, will release in theatres on April 7, 2023. In addition to Varun, 'Bawaal' will also feature Janhvi Kapoor.

354.title: Angad Bedi to star opposite Mrunal Thakur in 'Lust Stories 2': Report
354.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi will reportedly star opposite Mrunal Thakur in director R Balki's segment of the anthology film, 'Lust Stories 2'. The upcoming project will mark Angad and Balki's second collaboration after 'Ghoomer', an upcoming film starring Abhishek Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Saiyami Kher. Angad will reportedly start working on Balki's segment from August 7 in Mumbai.

355.title: 7-yr-old critically injured as leopard tries to drag him into forest in UP
355.article_body: A seven-year-old boy was critically injured after a leopard attacked and tried to drag him into the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district. The boy was saved after villagers heard him scream and rushed to save him. Hearing the commotion, the leopard left the boy and escaped into the forest. The boy suffered deep wounds on his neck and head.

356.title: Govt engineer arrested to taking bribe of ₹50,000 in Rajasthan
356.article_body: A junior engineer working under the Rajasthan government was arrested for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹50,000 in the state's Chittorgarh district. The accused, Phoolchand Swami, was caught red-handed by an Anti-Corruption Bureau team, an official said. Swami had demanded the money from a contractor to clear the latter's outstanding bills amounting to ₹48 lakh.

357.title: Brokerage firm's director, owners arrested in Mumbai for cheating investors
357.article_body: A brokerage firm's director and its owners have been arrested by the Mumbai Police after it was found that the firm had allegedly cheated its investors to the tune of ₹1.54 crore. Three accused, Sunil, Dhiren and Anurag, have been arrested while a fourth accused, Jairaj, is absconding, police said. Notably, the firm cheated people while managing their trading accounts.

358.title: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh lifts 319 kg at CWG, misses medal by 1 kg
358.article_body: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh on Monday finished fourth in the men's 81-kg category at CWG 2022. The 25-year-old lifted a total of 319 kg, with 143 kg in snatch and 176 kg in the clean jerk. He attempted a 180-kg lift in his last attempt in clean and jerk but failed to lift and missed a medal by 1 kg.

359.title: Debris from SpaceX rocket launched in 2020 falls on sheep farm in Aus; pics released
359.article_body: Debris from a SpaceX rocket crashed onto a sheep farm in Australia on July 9. An astrophysicist said the debris belonged to the SpaceX Crew-1 Trunk capsule, launched in 2020. When a rocket is launched, pieces of the spacecraft often separate from the primary payload and either burn up due to friction with Earth's atmosphere or land in oceans instead.

360.title: Atul, Aditya said newcomer shouldn't do 'Laal..': Aamir on Junaid's test video
360.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that a test video with his son Junaid was shot for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and that he was blown away by it. He said that people said he should take Junaid in the film. However, Khan said that scriptwriter Atul and filmmaker Aditya Chopra said a newcomer shouldn't do the film.

361.title: Didn’t have distributors for 'My Brother...'; Karan, Aditya helped me: Onir
361.article_body: Filmmaker Onir, in his memoir 'I Am Onir & I Am Gay', revealed he struggled to distribute his film 'My Brother...Nikhil'. He added producer-actor Sanjay Suri asked Karan Johar to watch the film. Onir said Karan loved the film, however, he didn't have the infrastructure to release the film. He stated Karan called Aditya Chopra, who agreed to distribute it.

362.title: There's scope that India will win more medals at CWG 2022: Anurag Thakur
362.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said there's scope that India will win more medals in ongoing Commonwealth Games 2022. "I'd like to congratulate Indian weightlifters and all other athletes of Commonwealth Games...our hopes have been ascended and we'll be winning more accolades in the coming time," he added. India have won three gold, two silver and one bronze medals so far.

363.title: UP school makes students recite Kalma for 'equality'; probe ordered
363.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police and administration reached Kanpur's Florets International School on Monday after a video allegedly showing Hindu students being made to recite 'Kalma', an Islamic oath of allegiance, surfaced online. "We have prayers for all four religions. We want to teach students that all religions are equal," the school's principal clarified. An inquiry has been ordered into the matter.

364.title: Seth Rogen told me to watch 'RRR', I highly recommend it: Actor's mom
364.article_body: Sandy Rogen, mother of filmmaker-actor Seth Rogen, wrote on Twitter, "Seth told us to watch this movie on Netflix called 'RRR'. Well, I highly recommend it." Several Hollywood celebrities, including 'Doctor Strange' writer Jon Spaihts and filmmaker Joe Russo, have praised the film. 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards.

365.title: We're focused on our target: Captain Savita on match vs England at CWG
365.article_body: Ahead of their third Pool A game against England on Tuesday in the ongoing CWG 2022, Indian women's hockey team captain Savita Punia has said though the English side will have the home advantage, they are focused on their target. "It'll be all about getting the basics right...It's a crucial game and we're focused on our target," she added.

366.title: Attempt to divert attention from SSC scam: Malviya on WB to get 7 new districts
366.article_body: Soon after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that the state Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, BJP’s Amit Malviya said that it is an attempt to divert attention from the SSC scam. "She must explain [from] where a debt-trapped West Bengal government gets money to run new districts?" he asked.

367.title: Poor getting 2-time free meals in India when other countries facing crisis: BJP MP
367.article_body: Addressing Lok Sabha, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey said that we should be thankful to PM Narendra Modi as poor in India are getting two-time meals free of cost. "If we see Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Singapore, everywhere inflation is rising...Amid such a situation if poor are getting two-time meals free of cost then shouldn't we thank PM," he said.

368.title: LeBron James invests in Germany's bike maker Canyon Bicycles
368.article_body: Four-time NBA champion LeBron James has invested in Germany-based Canyon Bicycles through his family office LRMR Ventures. Canyon Bicycles, which manufactures a range of motorcycles and mountain bikes, said it has raised $30.5 million in funding from LRMR Ventures and US private equity firm SC Holdings. "LRMR and the SC team immediately understood our mission," Canyon's Founder Roman Arnold said.

369.title: History-sheeter killed in moving car in Hyd over property dispute
369.article_body: A man involved in at least 10 criminal cases was shot dead in Hyderabad in a moving car in what is suspected to be the fallout of a property dispute, police said. The deceased was travelling in a car with the accused on the pretext of a meeting. The discussion led to heated arguments, following which the deceased was shot.

370.title: 300 firefighters battle wildfire in France's Gard; 4 injured
370.article_body: Four firefighters were injured, two of whom were treated for burn injuries, while battling a wildfire in Aubais in France's Gard on Sunday, French Interior Minister said. About 300 firefighters were tackling the blaze, which burned 250 hectares of pine forest, authorities added. The wildfire was "very violent" due to strong winds and dry weather, a fire service spokesperson said.

371.title: SP names tribal candidate for UP council bypolls
371.article_body: Samajwadi Party has fielded tribal candidate Kirti Kol for the August 11 bypolls to the UP Legislative Council. She is the daughter of former MP Bhailal Kol. The two seats for which by-elections will be conducted, became vacant after the death of SP's Ahmad Hassan and resignation of BJP's Thakur Jaiveer Singh.

372.title: Eknath Shinde govt in Maha will collapse for sure: Aaditya Thackeray
372.article_body: Maharashtra never tolerates treachery and the Eknath Shinde-led government will collapse for sure, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said on Monday. Aaditya added that the focus of the Shinde government is on "dirty politics" and not the welfare of the people of Maharashtra. The state witnessed incessant rains and floods, but the government is not bothered, he alleged.

373.title: HC reserves order on ex-Haryana CM's plea for suspension of sentence
373.article_body: Delhi High Court has reserved order on ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala's plea seeking suspension of the four-year sentence imposed on him in a disproportionate assets case. "He's 88 and the appeal cannot be decided in one go," his advocate said. In May, a trial court awarded him a four-year jail term for acquiring disproportionate assets from 1993 to 2006.

374.title: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut sent to ED custody till August 4
374.article_body: A special court on Monday granted the custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) till August 4 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier, the ED had sought an 8-day custody of Raut. ED's lawyer claimed that Raut was summoned four times but he appeared before the agency only once.

375.title: Nushrratt to start shooting for 'Chhorii 2' in November: Report
375.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha will reportedly start shooting for the sequel to 'Chhorii' in November this year. The story of 'Chhorii 2' will continue from part one and take on a new dimension, Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Chhorii', a horror film directed by Vishal Furia, was a remake of a Marathi film titled 'Lapachhapi'.

376.title: 'Fast X' director Leterrier is dope, we're lucky to have him: Michelle
376.article_body: Actress Michelle Rodriguez, speaking about the 'Fast X' director Louis Leterrier, has said, "He's so dope, man...We're...lucky to have him." She added Leterrier came with an "energy of love". "We haven't had that in 'Fast and Furious' for a...long time where we get somebody excited who's a real fan," she added. Leterrier replaced Justin Lin as the film's director.

377.title: Probing head of country's largest chip investment fund: China's watchdog
377.article_body: China's corruption watchdog said it was probing Ding Wenwu, the head of China Integrated Circuit Industry Investment Fund, China's largest state-backed chip investment fund. Wenwu is "suspected of serious violation of the law" and is "currently undergoing disciplinary review", the watchdog said. The Fund was launched in 2014 and raised about $20.54 billion for its first fund.

378.title: BJP MPs stage protest against Bengal CM over SSC scam
378.article_body: West Bengal BJP MPs staged a protest outside the Parliament against Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over the alleged involvement of sacked TMC minister Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam. They were seen holding placards and raising slogans demanding arrests of those involved in the scam. Partha and his close associate Arpita Mukherjee are currently in the Enforcement Directorate's custody.

379.title: 22-year-old man stabbed to death in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas
379.article_body: A man was stabbed to death allegedly by a group of men in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas. The deceased, Anawarul Haq (22), hailed from Bihar and worked in a Biharipur-based factory which made school bags, police said. The CCTV footage showed some men, who are currently absconding, attacking the victim with knives and fleeing the spot, police added.

380.title: Fake call centre cheating US residents busted in Delhi, 1 arrested
380.article_body: The Delhi Police crime branch has busted a fake call centre, which allegedly cheated American residents by making them believe their computers were affected by a virus or hacked and arrested one person. The accused confessed that the call centre asked for $50-500 to fix the problem with the victims' computers. Incriminating evidence was found at the centre, police said.

381.title: Mani Ratnam completed Ponniyin Selvan 1 & 2 in 120 days: Karthi
381.article_body: Actor Karthi revealed filmmaker Mani Ratnam completed 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' and 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' in 120 days. "It's not easy to make two films in 120 days. We'd put on our makeup at 2-2.30 am. There'd be 30 people waiting ready to put makeup for us," he added. Karthi said they used to take the first shot at 6:30 am.

382.title: WhatsApp testing feature to allow group admins to delete messages: Report
382.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp is testing a new feature that allows group admins to delete messages for every member in the group chat, according to a report by WABetaInfo. This feature comes as a part of the beta release of the app on Google Play Store with version number 2.22.17.12. WhatsApp was reportedly testing waveforms for voice notes recently.

383.title: People of Gujarat will get spurious liquor if they vote for BJP: Kejriwal
383.article_body: AAP national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that spurious liquor is being sold openly in Gujarat. "At present, people of Gujarat have two options, either they'll get spurious liquor if they vote for them (BJP) or they'll get employment if they vote for us," he added. "Electricity, school, jobs will be the issues now," Kejriwal stated.

384.title: Suspension of 4 Congress MPs withdrawn in Lok Sabha
384.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla revoked the suspension of Congress MPs, Manickam Tagore, Ramya Haridas, Jothimani and TN Prathapan, on Monday. The four party MPs were suspended on July 25 for the entire session by the speaker for carrying placards inside the House as a mark of protest. Congress leader Shashi Tharoor had earlier demanded the suspension to be revoked.

385.title: ₹3 cr illegal transaction done using a teacher's PAN number; FIR filed in Mumbai
385.article_body: A case of cheating was registered in Mumbai's Shivaji Nagar Police Station against an unidentified person for allegedly using the PAN number of a teacher for operating a GSTIN account and conducting transactions worth over ₹3 crore, police said. The matter came to light when the victim, Anil Jare, approached a CA to file his income tax return recently.

386.title: India create history, confirm their 1st ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG
386.article_body: India on Monday created history by confirming their first-ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG. India reached the gold medal match of the women's fours lawn bowls event at CWG 2022. India defeated New Zealand 16-13 in semi-final. India were represented by Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey in the semi-final. The final will take place tomorrow.

387.title: He knows exactly what is required: Bhuvneshwar on Arshdeep Singh
387.article_body: Praising Arshdeep Singh, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said his teammate's best thing is that he knows exactly what is required. "What kind of field setting is needed, how to bowl to each batsman- very few newcomers display that kind of maturity," he added. Arshdeep claimed 2/18 on his T20I debut against England and 2/24 in Friday's win against West Indies.

388.title: Woman who robbed husband 3 days after wedding arrested in MP
388.article_body: Police have arrested a woman along with her two accomplices who robbed her husband of ₹2 lakh just three days after their wedding. The incident occurred in May in Madhya Pradesh's Pithampur. Police had formed a special team to catch the three accused. The money has been recovered and the accused are being questioned.

389.title: 3 dead as car skids off road, falls into stream in Kerala amid rain
389.article_body: Three members of a family died when their car skidded off the road and fell into a nearby stream swollen with rainwater while trying to overtake a bus in Kerala's Pathanamthitta district. The passengers drowned in the stream by the time locals could rescue them, police said. An orange alert has been issued in seven districts of the state.

390.title: Nobody knew he took part, WB minister seems ignorant: Brother of CWG winner Sheuli
390.article_body: The brother of Commonwealth Games 2022 gold-winning weightlifter Achinta Sheuli said that nobody knew the 20-year-old from West Bengal participated in the Birmingham games. "Even the state's Sports Minister seems ignorant," said Alok, adding, "We need government support." Achinta, who created a Games record of 313 kg, credited his brother for the win.

391.title: Ajay Devgn has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste: 'Bholaa' writer Aamil
391.article_body: Speaking about the scripting process of 'Bholaa' with actor Ajay Devgn, co-writer Aamil Keeyan Khan has said, "Ajay has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste." Aamil added, "He knows exactly what to tweak, add and subtract to elevate a scene." The 'Runway 34' writer further said that Ajay is the happiest when he is wearing the director's hat.

392.title: Policeman beaten up for stopping tractor with illegally mined sand in Rajasthan
392.article_body: A police constable who stopped a tractor trolley with illegally mined sand was beaten up with sticks and iron rods by the driver's associates in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, police said. Constable Ram Chandra received multiple injuries and was shifted to a government hospital in Jhalawar. After thrashing the constable, the accused ran away with the tractor.

393.title: In previous years, England would've played more shots earlier: Morgan
393.article_body: Ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the Jos-Buttler-led side, who lost the South Africa T20Is at home, lacked "aggressive batting" in the final two games of the three-match series. "In previous years, England would've played a lot more shots earlier as opposed to giving it more thought, more calculation," stated Morgan. England also lost the white-ball series to India in July.

394.title: ED being misused, extraordinary selective targeting of Oppn: Tharoor
394.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday said that the government institutions are not there to serve political purposes, the Times Now reported. "The ED is being misused…You have got an extraordinary selective targeting of Opposition people and I find this unacceptable because we are a country where democracy is a value in itself and it should be preserved," he added.

395.title: Accident causes traffic congestion at NH-48, Gurugram Police share details
395.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform commuters about traffic congestion, caused by an accident, on National Highway 48 (NH-48). "Traffic congestion has been reported on NH-48 near Rajiv chowk towards Delhi due to vehicle accident. Our traffic officials present on the spot to facilitate the traffic.@gurgaonpolice," read the tweet by Gurugram Traffic Police.

396.title: Will start shooting for 'Singham 3' in April 2023: Director Rohit Shetty
396.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty in an interview said that he'll start shooting for 'Singham 3' with actor Ajay Devgn in April 2023. "We have already started working on Singham 3...It is going to be the biggest cop universe ever that we have made till date," he added. Rohit had earlier said that 'Singham 3' will be bigger than Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Sooryavanshi'.

397.title: Video claiming a Bengaluru pothole is 10 years old goes viral
397.article_body: A video claiming that a pothole near Bengaluru's Kanakapura main road is 10 years old has gone viral on social media. The video was shared by a Twitter handle by the name of 'I CHANGE Hemmigepura'. A user replied to the tweet saying, "Proposing a birthday party for the pothole." Another user wrote, "Should declare the place as heritage monument."

398.title: India's 1st monkeypox death confirmed, victim was 22-year-old Kerala man who visited UAE
398.article_body: Kerala health department has confirmed that the 22-year-old man who died on Saturday had succumbed to monkeypox. The confirmation came from the National Institute of Virology in Pune, making it India's first confirmed monkeypox death. Earlier, Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that the man had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE before he reached Kerala on July 22.

399.title: Wanted to jump in a hole: Meg Lanning on missing hat-trick catch at CWG
399.article_body: Australia Women captain Meg Lanning dropped Barbados' Keila Elliott's catch off Australia spinner Alana King's hat-trick delivery during their match at the CWG 2022. On being asked about it, Lanning said, "I'll have nightmares, I wanted to dig a hole and jump in it as quick as I could." Australia defeated Barbados by nine wickets in the game.

400.title: West Bengal to get 7 new districts, total number to increase to 30
400.article_body: The West Bengal Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday. The new districts will be Berhampore, Kandi, Sunderbans, Bashirhat, Ichamati, Ranaghat and Bishnupur. A senior state government official said that the decision was taken to ensure smooth administrative operations. At present, the state has a total of 23 districts.

401.title: Uddhav visits arrested MP Sanjay Raut's house to meet his family
401.article_body: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray reached arrested MP Sanjay Raut's residence on Monday to meet the former's family. Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case on Monday early morning, was slated to be produced before a special PMLA court in Mumbai later in the day.

402.title: I feel more comfortable doing massy entertainers: Varun Dhawan
402.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said that he feels "more comfortable" doing mass entertainers. "Every time I walk into a set to play a character which is very different from what I have played before, it gives me jitters," he added. Varun stated, "Even if you're doing a massy entertainer, you need to figure out newer ways of entertaining the audience."

403.title: New Bengaluru-Mysuru highway to be ready for use in Oct: Centre
403.article_body: The first phase of renovation of the Bengaluru-Mysuru national highway, which covers a 61 km-stretch between Mysuru and Nidaghatta, will be completed in September, Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Meanwhile, the 56.2 km--long Nidaghatta-Bengaluru stretch is likely to be opened by October 20. The highway's six main carriageways will be ready for public use by October-end, he added.
